Weekly Thursday open figure drawing night at the Shoestring Press!

Models include Burlesque performers, drag kings and queens, SVA and Pratt model alums, dancers, yogis, and more...

6:30-9:30pm, stay afterward for dinner gratis! Every Thursday afternoon we fire up the crockpot and see what comes of it. Bring desert or fruit if you so desire. Beer is in the fridge, coffee is hot (or cold depending on the season) and the camaraderie is warm.

At the Shoestring Press's new digs (we re-opened in February) 663 Classon Ave between Bergen and Dean in Crown Heights.

Members of the Press pay $10, $15 for non-members, or $10 if you bring a friend.

results.description:
This is a FREE yoga class that meets from 6:30 to 8:00 pm, instructed by Chia-Ti Chiu, one of the organizers of this Meetup group.

It is an OPEN LEVEL HATHA FLOW class, appropriate for beginners to advanced students.  There are many variations given to accommodate the different levels of yoga experience.


** You will need to bring your own mat.  There are no yoga mats for rent or use. You can buy yoga mats inexpensively at Marshalls, Filene's Basement, Modells, TJ Maxx, and Target. Many yoga studios also carry a wide range of mats for sale.

IF YOU COME FOR THE FIRST TIME: PLEASE FILL OUT THE REGISTRATION FORM AT THE FRONT DESK. RSVPing on Meetup does not count as Beacon registration.  Your participation and registration helps keep the numbers needed for this program to stay free!


FOR EVERYONE: PLEASE SIGN IN AT THE FRONT DESK CLEARLY AND LEGIBLY

DIRECTIONS:The Beacon Center is located in PS 198. It is an elementary school that takes up the whole block; entrance is on 3rd Ave. The exact address is: 1700 Third Avenue, between 95 & 96 St.

BY SUBWAY: 6 train to 96 St. Walk 1 block East on 96 St to Third Ave. Make a right onto Third Ave.

BY BUS: Third Ave Bus - M101, 102, 103 to 96 St.

Madison Ave Bus - M1, M2,M3, or M4 To 96 St.


ANY QUESTIONS? Contact Chia-Ti through Meetup or through her website: www.onelovewellness.com

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Thursday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. This group meets in the Sports Bar Restaurant in the rear of the building past the bowling lanes and pool tables.  There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Five Tribes, Kingsburg, Istanbul, Catan, Pirate's Cove, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Stone Age, Suburbia, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Lords of Waterdeep, Splendor, The Cave, and more.  

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark
results.how_to_find_us: This group meets in the Sports Bar Restaurant in the rear of the building past the bowling lanes and pool tables.
results.name: Thursday Night Board Games at Dave & Busters!

results.description:
Many investor that we talk to are frightened to invest out-of-state, because they have an inherent mistrust (or maybe a bad experience) with property managers.

Property managers are your feet on the ground, and he success of the plan that you have for your property really depends on how effectively it’s managed. We view our property managers as PARTNERS, not EMPLOYEES.

Come and join us October 8th, where we’ll break down:

·  How to screen property management, and the three questions you MUST ask

·  How to select the right type of management for the right property

·  A case study of leveraging property management successfully

 I’m looking forward to seeing you in Westbury – make sure you grab your seat by clicking here
results.name: Apartment Investing: Property Management

results.description:
I'm loving the momentum of this group and witnessing how folks are improving their language skills and making friends. To me, it makes all of this worth doing!

So let's get ready for another great meetup! 

As always, first introduce yourself in the language you are studying. Then introduce yourself in your native language. 

Following that, we will dedicate 30 minutes towards helping those learning English, then 30 minutes of Chinese. 

Then we mingle again until its time to go. 

We are usually done by 8:30 but those that want to stick around or continue hanging out after the meetup (bubble tea, karaoke, etc) are more than welcome to do so!

Thanks again for your support thus far and let's have many more great meetups! 非常感谢大家的支持！
results.name: Chinese and English Language Exchange

group.name: Queens Chinese and English Language Exchange Meetup

results.description:
Due to a complication with location, we have had to reschedule the meetup.

The new meetup will be held in the same location as before

please note that we may be on the 7th or the 8th floor. so go to both floors until you find us

if you have any questions call or text me:

Anton[masked]

The meetup:

We are specifically focused on projects that need funding and people who have funds and are looking for deals.  Everyone is welcome to come, but investors and entrepreneurs are preferred. Based on past meetups, we have ran out of space and time before, so there will be a maximum of 10 people presenting. presenters are on a first come first serve basis. 

As usual the meetup is broken up in to 3 parts

Part 1 is meet and greet

Part 2 is deal presentations

Part 3 is mingle

Presentations will now be strictly limited to 5 minutes + 2 minutes Q&A

To pitch your deal. You can bring any supporting information including, PowerPoint, video, handouts, ect... If you need assistance setting up in advance please let me know 1-2 days in advance.

We have no restrictions on what kind of deals you want to present, anything goes.

If you are presenting or if you are an investor and want to bring a partner or an associate, you may bring up to 2 other people with you for a total of 3 people for the price of 1 attendee.

My email: [masked]

ps; as before I will gather all attendees information and email it to everyone at the end of the meetup.
results.how_to_find_us: 31 W 34 st, New York, NY 7 or 8 floor
results.name: Present investment delas shark tank style, meet investors

results.description: Hi girls. I am so excited to meet all of you. Looks like we have a great bunch of girls coming. The weather is turning out to be perfect for this venue. This is a spectacular year round rooftop venue. Primary cocktails. The do have a fabulous light bite snacking menu. If you RSVP and don't show we will remove you from the group. This is for girls that just want to have fun! There has been a change in the reservations since we had such a great response. We were forced to change the reservation status to "open" because of a ridiculous deposit they were asking to hold the table. The rep from the venue assured me  that at the time we are arriving we should have no issues with getting a great table. I will post my status  on this page when I check in. I have also posted a picture of me in the photo section of the meetup. Hopefully this will help us find one another. Of course if you are having trouble you can message me on this meet up page. Looking forward to toasting to a great meetup group.

results.description:
Come out to the October SingApplause! Session!  (November's session is the last session for the Fall season.)

Practice performing your songs at SingApplause!© This session gives you a chance to try out the music you’ve been working on in a safe, supportive and fun environment!

If you want try out a new song, brush up on an older one, present an original song or try out an entirely new style, SingApplause! is the place for you!

SingApplause! is simple, one person sings, everyone else applauds, and then the next person takes a turn, that’s it!

There’s no criticism, no coaching, no skills evaluation or any other negative commentary.  So whether you're a professional singer, amateur, wedding/event singer or songwriter - SingApplause! is for you!

If you are working on an aria, art song, spiritual, theater song, original song, jazz standard, whatever! - This session is for you!

We have a lot of fun in these sessions, so I hope you can make it and join in the fun!

Dr. Richard Duncan, Pianist (extraordinary pianist that can play just about any sheet music you give him!)

When: Thursday, October 8, 2015

Time: 6:45 – 9:00 PM
Cost: $15.00

Where: Yeoryia Studios
Othello Studio, 5th floor
2067 Broadway
(Between 71 - 72nd Streets)

*Please bring 3 - 5 songs that you would like to sing.

RSVP by Wednesday, October 7th.

All attendees sing! No auditors! Thanks.
results.name: October SingApplause! Session!!!

results.description:
Last week two of the Meetup teams got the Bonus Round Question right and each team won an appetizer, nice job!!

And if you're coming right from work Vintage does serve food...very Reasonable and Good.

Vintage has been serving the White Plains community for many years.

It's comfortable, affordable & centrally located.



**There will be a prize for the winning team!**


And there will also be bonus questions where a team can win stuff!!


Bring your friends or you can join other Meetup members to form a team.

It's a great opportunity to use all that information you have acquired over the years.  *_*


There will be an entertaining mix of questions!

Let's get those brain cells working & have some FUN!!!

There are 5 rounds
Questions are read off and each team writes down the answers....it's a team effort!

****All are welcome to attend!****


And there are always people from the Pub itself playing, we will be joining in on the FUN!

I look forward to seeing you there! *_*

Please join us to hang out, relax and make new friends.
We'll chat, grab some magazines, books, snacks and meet in the cafe area. A friendly game usually breaks out too.
This is a large store with a big used book section, a music section, and an upstairs lounging spot. There is also a very large parking lot.

***Please only RSVP "yes" if you are able to attend the event.

$1 fee to help cover Meetup costs. Please find the envelope upon your arrival. 

See you soon!

results.description:
Note:  This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and several of their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those attending.  If you have any questions regarding this event, please contact Dave directly at [masked]. 

Heidelberg German Restaurant has been serving up German specialties since 1936.  It is one of the only remaining businesses from the once thriving Germantown section of Manhattan.  Join us for an authentic German dinner, socializing and beer in an atmosphere that will make you think that you are in Munich! Here is how it works...

1. Make your reservation (please only reserve if you know that you can attend)

2. Check out their menu http://www.heidelberg-nyc.com/menu/

3. Arrive at 7pm for cocktails at the bar.

4. 7:30pm seating for dinner

5.  Order what you would like off the menu At the end of the meal we will collect only for what you ate plus the tax, 20% tip and a $5 donation for the organizers dinner.  PLEASE BRING CASH ONLY.

Can I come alone?  Yes 99% of those attending will likely be on their own.

Dress code: Business casual

What to expect: 10-15 members and friends coming together for a great meal and conversation.  Most likely 20's - 40's with some 50's?

This event is being sponsored by The New York Social Network which is a collaboration of several different Meet Up Groups (www.newyorksocialnetwork.com).  The number of RSVP's below reflect only a portion of those attending.  Please only sign up for this event if you are serious about attending.  We have a 3 flakes and you are out rule!  If you have questions regarding this or other events, please contact the event host Dave Cervini at[masked] or e-mail [masked].
results.name: Oktoberfest German Dinner: Pay As You Go

results.description:
A collaborative effort by Peatix and Komeeda, Chef Showdown aims to provide a platform for new and ambitious chefs to showcase their creative talents via a social and interactive evening. The event will bring together three innovative chefs and food lovers (a.k.a. you!), for a night of bites, drinks and conversation.


Competition Details

Three chefs will each be creating two bite-sized appetizers reflecting their creative abilities. You, the audience, will taste, critique and judge each bite based on creativity, presentation and taste. The winner will be crowned the Showdown Champion!


Event Details

Ticket Pricing: $25 Online I $30 Cash At Door.

Ticket includes all six bites, beer/wine, welcome hors d'oeuvres and the opportunity to vote for the Chef Showdown #3 winner.

TICKETS CAN BE PURCHASED AT : http://chefshowdown3.peatix.com


Event Rundown

6:30pm - Doors open

7:00pm - Event announcements & chef introductions

7:15-8:00pm - Chef Showdown

8:30pm - Showdown winner announced

Check out photos from our last event on Facebook

All sales are final and non-refundable.
results.name: Chef Showdown Round 3: TICKETED EVENT

venue.name: Namaste Bookshop's Namaste Healing Center Floor

results.description:
Free Event with Andrew Vidich

Meditation: And the After Life Journey of the Soul

​Based on the Book Spark of the Divine by Sant Rajinder Singh Ji Maharaj

All great religious and spiritual traditions have laid great emphasis on the meaning and understanding of death and the afterlife.  In this workshop we will explore the many faceted faces of death and the after life journey of the soul viewed through the lens of the great Masters of spirituality .  

Who we are, where do we go and what is the nature of the soul’s existence after death will form the basis of our inquiry. No matter who we are each of us will have to face the moment of death. By understanding

what is the soul, what dies and what lies beyond this physical existence each of us can learn more fully how to live in the present moment. Death may be the single greatest teacher we all encounter in our lives. 

Join us for an interactive evening lecture and discussion followed by a demonstration of a simple but profound method of meditation to begin our own inner journey into the after life .
results.name: FREE EVENT WITH ANDREW VIDICH MEDITATION: AND THE AFTER LIFE JOURNEY OF THE SOUL

results.description:
Christmas Blues Rock Ensemble

Join our Christmas Blues Rock Ensemble in time to perform a great Holiday show in December!
We’ll be playing Christmas classics “Merry Christmas, Baby”, “Please come home for Christmas”, “JIngle Bell Rock” and more!
We’ll have 10 practices and then perform on Sunday, December 13th at Arlene’s Grocery at 3pm. 

SHOW

The show will be at Arlene's Grocery in the East Village December 13th at 1pm(soundcheck) and doors at 2pm. Our show will be at 3pm. Arlene's is an awesome show venue with professional stage, sound and lights, everyone will be miked or amplified. If you are coming to rehearsal with a portable amp you should also bring it to the venue.

We will have a drummer and a singer TBA.

There will be tickets for this show, they can be purchase before hand (starting in November) at $5 or at the door for $10.

There is a show fee of $30 for each ensemble member that will go toward venue, sound engineer and hired musicians costs.

Arlene's Grocery is strictly 21+ and no children will be allowed at the show even if they are accompanied by the parent, I'm sorry:( :(

There are two bars on site and lots of food spots and great restaurants in the area for before or after the show.

CALENDAR

Our practice schedule starts Thursday 6-8pm on October 1st.

It is important that you attend to as many as you can if you plan on performing, a required 7 session minimum will be necessary to perform and VERY IMPORTANT that you come to the last 2 practices which will be with a drummer and a singer
results.name: Join our Christmas Blues Rock ensemble!

Note:  This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and several of their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those attending.  If you have any questions regarding this event, please contact Dave directly at [masked].


Heidelberg German Restaurant has been serving up German specialties since 1936.  It is one of the only remaining businesses from the once thriving Germantown section of Manhattan.  Join us for an authentic German dinner, socializing and beer in an atmosphere that will make you think that you are in Munich! Here is how it works...

1. Make your reservation (please only reserve if you know that you can attend)

2. Check out their menu http://www.heidelberg-nyc.com/menu/

3. Arrive at 7pm for cocktails at the bar.

4. 7:30pm seating for dinner

5.  Order what you would like off the menu At the end of the meal we will collect only for what you ate plus the tax, 20% tip and a $5 donation for the organizers dinner.  PLEASE BRING CASH ONLY.

Can I come alone?  Yes 99% of those attending will likely be on their own.

Dress code: Business casual

What to expect: 10-15 members and friends coming together for a great meal and conversation.  Most likely 20's - 40's with some 50's?

This event is being sponsored by The New York Social Network which is a collaboration of several different Meet Up Groups (www.newyorksocialnetwork.com).  The number of RSVP's below reflect only a portion of those attending.  Please only sign up for this event if you are serious about attending.  We have a 3 flakes and you are out rule!  If you have questions regarding this or other events, please contact the event host Dave Cervini at[masked] or e-mail [masked].

results.description:
The Bisexual Women's Group will meet in the front lobby at 7 pm to see photography of LGBT people in South Africa - as well as Judy Chicago's "The Dinner Party".

This event is intended for WOMEN ONLY. Trans-inclusive.

The Brooklyn Museum of Art
Elizabeth A. Sackler Center for Feminist Art, 4th Floor

Zanele Muholi meshes her work in photography, video, and installation with human rights activism to create visibility for the black lesbian and transgender communities of South Africa. Zanele Muholi: Isibonelo/Evidence is the most comprehensive museum presentation to date of Muholi’s works and features several of the artist’s ongoing projects about lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and intersex (LGBTI) communities, both in her home country and abroad.
https://www.brooklynmuseum.org/exhibitions/zanele_muholi

On the same floor, is Judy Chicago's "Dinner Party", a feminist classic.

The Brooklyn Museum is open on Thursdays from 11 am–10 pm. It is always pay what you wish. The suggested admission for adults is $16 - but you can pay less.

Take the #2 or #3 subway to the Eastern Parkway stop.
results.name: Zanele Muholi & Feminist Art at the Brooklyn Museum

results.description:
www.SlipperRoom.com

www.fxnetworks.com/shows/american-horror-story/about


www.HotsyTotsyBurlesque.com


Hotsy Totsy Burlesque's tribute to AMERICAN HORROR STORY!

Featuring:


CHERRY PITZ,
CLARA COQUETTE,
GEMINI BLITZ,
ERIKA RODGERS,
MARY CYN,
MATT KNIFE,
PETITE RENARD,

and your host, HANDSOME BRAD.

SPONSORED BY SAILOR JERRY SPICED RUM, WHO PROMISE DRINK SPECIALS AND AWESOME SWAG.

Following on the footsteps of Hotsy Totsy Burlesque’s successful Disney, Harry Potter, The Big Lebowski, Mad Men, Doctor Who and Star Wars 1978 Holiday Special tribute shows, Cherry Pitz and Joe the Shark present a burlesque tribute to the iconic FX Network television series American Horror Story!

Produced by Ryan Murphy and Brad Falchuk, AHS has had several seasons that have terrified and intrigued audiences - Murder House, Asylum, Coven, Freakshow, and premiering the night before Hotsy, Lady Gaga's HOTEL. AHS: Freakshow garnered a total of twenty Emmy Award nominations, the most for any season of the show. Hotsy Totsy Burlesque is New York’s only episodic, monthly burlesque show featuring a different script each month and a rotating cast. Hotsy Totsy is a high camp soap opera featuring some of the best burlesque talent New York has to offer.

Once a month you are invited to the basement of The Home For Wayward Girls and Fallen Women. The residents of the home need money to keep their hotel open and to buy G-strings and glitter. Sadly, the shows have had their technical difficulties and in the past as they’ve had to combat, zombies, gangsters, human-animal hybrids, televangelists and snake oil salesmen. The performers promise you beautiful, clothing-averse women, lots of laughs, spinning tassels, and flying underpants. So join us for Hotsy Totsy Burlesque at The Home For Wayward Girls and Fallen Women where the motto is “We’ve fallen, we can’t get up, and we like it that way!”

Door opens at 7pm. Show starts at 8pm. $10 per person. Get your tickets at <a>www.SlipperRoom.com.</a> They guarantee you get in, but if you want a physical seat, show up early!

https://vimeo.com/58911751

https://youtu.be/VCvFL3DmYr8

AND, after Hotsy Totsy finishes, you can stick around for FREE to see the two other shows that follow it, the Wiggle Room & Stache Novak's Midnight Fingers!


https://vimeo.com/135482560
results.name: Hotsy Totsy Burlesque's tribute to AMERICAN HORROR STORY!

results.description:
The Sound Mind gathering explores the vibrational and sound healing for personal meditation, soul expansion, as well as physical well-being. 

When we learn to use our breath and voice for toning, chanting, and psychosomatic actualization, we become powerful healers. The gifts we were born to share come to fruition if we but dare to explore, expand, AND express our vibrational state. You can tune your Soul-Body to higher dimensions and progress your visionary abilities following the scale of sound and color - starting where you are and who you are at the present moment and then climbing up.

The starting point is like looking at a hiking map with a little red circle that says 'you are here' and all the possible trails ahead and then you take off - transcendence path is a process that is anchored in the body. No matter how natural and sacred, there is no vine, shroom, or chemical that will take you to the next level of spiritual consciousness. You can change your state and catch a glimpse of your transcendent vision, yes, right here within your Soul-Body.

Sound Mind is about a durable and steady progress into who you were meant to become in this amazing moment of opportunity that we call a human life. It goes fast, so why not …make a sound?
results.name: Sound Mind - Heal Your Life with Sounding, Toning, and Chanting

results.description:
Its open board game night! Grab some friends and your favorite board game and head on over to the Highlander location in Boonton to have some fun.  Don't have a game, or interested in playing a new one?  We've got an extensive demo library open to everyone so feel free to pick whichever game strikes your fancy, grab a group, and play. 


Additionally there will be a featured demo of a different game each week, I'll be updating this meetup each week so you guys know what we've got. 


Other than that feel free to use this meetup as a way to organize your own games for Thursday nights, we've got space for everyone and plenty of people already show up so picking up a group should be no problem at all.  Hope to see you there!
results.name: Open Board Game Night

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

90min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank  
M. [masked]

SoccerBeyond.com
[masked]


Feel free to like us on http://www.facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

results.description:
The New York Academy of Sciences, as part of their "From Knowledge to Wisdom" series, will be giving a panel discussion "The Paradox of Pleasure" on the science of happiness.

Link: Register with NYAS here.


Tickets are $5 for members, $15 for non-members, $7 for non-member students.

The pursuit of happiness is enshrined in the founding document of our nation as a fundamental and inalienable right. Yet nowhere is the method of this pursuit clearly defined. What, exactly, does it mean to be happy, and how can such happiness be sustained over the long-term? Can happiness be accurately gauged or measured? How does the paradoxical relationship between happiness and pleasure shape our quest to lead the good life? And what does modern science have to tell us about this universal yet elusive pursuit? Attorney and author Kim Azzarelli, historian Darrin McMahon, and social psychologist Barry Schwartz join forces to share their research and insight on happiness, pleasure, and the coveted good life.

*Reception to follow.

Featuring Kim Azzarelli, JD

Adjunct Professor at Cornell Law School and Founding Partner of Seneca Point Global
Author of "Fast Forward: How Women Can Achieve Power and Purpose"

Darrin McMahon, PhD

Professor of History at Dartmouth College
Author of "Happiness: A History"

Barry Schwartz, PhD

Dorwin Cartwright Professor of Social Theory and Social Action at Swarthmore College
Author of "The Paradox of Choice: Why More is Less"

results.name: NYAS: The New Science of Happiness

results.description:
The East River Park track is east of the FDR at East 6th Street. It is a little over a mile from the closest subway stops (6 to Astor Place or L to First Ave).

Thursday workouts change from week to week and will be announced in advance.

Important Information about East River Park Track: The Whippets have been running here for three years and have experienced thefts of our belongings. We will take extra precautions to keep our bags safe, but please avoid bringing valuables -- and it would be safest to run with your wallet on you.

Please be aware that there are limited overhead lights, so it gets a little dark, and during winter months the bathrooms are locked and the water fountains are off. If you have a bike, make sure you have a lock because you'll have to keep your bike outside the track area.

If you feel uncomfortable leaving your personal belongings at the track, you can drop them off at Ace Bar (531 East 5th Street between A and B) -- ask for Justin or Charlo and tell them you run with the team.  They will store our belongings for us.  ***Please note that they will not let you in without your ID so please bring that with you to the track.   http://www.acebar.com/about.html

See you there -- and please contact a Whippet captain if you have any questions!

Bi women will meet in the front lobby at 7 pm to see photography of LGBT people in South Africa - as well as Judy Chicago's "The Dinner Party".

The Brooklyn Museum of Art
Elizabeth A. Sackler Center for Feminist Art, 4th Floor

Zanele Muholi meshes her work in photography, video, and installation with human rights activism to create visibility for the black lesbian and transgender communities of South Africa. Zanele Muholi: Isibonelo/Evidence is the most comprehensive museum presentation to date of Muholi’s works and features several of the artist’s ongoing projects about lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and intersex (LGBTI) communities, both in her home country and abroad.
https://www.brooklynmuseum.org/exhibitions/zanele_muholi

On the same floor, is Judy Chicago's "Dinner Party", a feminist classic.

The Brooklyn Museum is open on Thursdays from 11 am–10 pm. It is always pay what you wish. The suggested admission for adults is $16 - but you can pay less.

Take the #2 or #3 subway to the Eastern Parkway stop.

results.description:
Greetings Heroes! 

It is with great pride that we can announce that eSports Hero andNebulous Gaming NYC have officially partnered in hopes that together we can provide the gamers of New York City with a strong community and a new place to call home. Located in Manhattan's Lower East Side, we are going to turn the 2,500+ square foot private venue into the hub for all gaming and eSports events on the East Coast.

With that said, bring out your laptop, phone, or tablet every Thursday, and join us for an evening of food, friends, and Hearthstone as we celebrate the re-launch of Nebulous Gaming NYC and our Weekly Fireside Program.

---

These Hearthstone Fireside Tournaments are to be hosted weekly in a completely private venue. Similar to how Magic the Gathering has coined "Friday Night Magic", we want to make "Thursday Night Firesides" something that will  always be available to you guys. We are taking the traditional Fireside format up a notch and you can expect that every week there will be at least one of the following taking place: (1) Deckbuilding Competition, (2) Challenge Stone Tournament, (3) Double Team Tournament (2v2), (4) Conquest Tournament.

As an official part of the Blizzard FSG program we will also do our very best to provide our Hearthstone community with Card Packs, and anything Swag Blizzard passes on to us.

$6 is the Grand Opening Price Discount and the cover will be collected at the door. Once you pay, feel free to stay as late as your heart desires (or at least until close which is usually around midnight). There are cool funky bodegas right around nebs where you can grab snacks / sandwiches throughout the night.

Nebulous Gaming NYC: 

https://www.facebook.com/NebulousGaming

---

The new Nebulous Venue is beautiful and very chill. The WiFi is blazing fast and there are power outlets for everyone. There will be Pizza, board games, Digital Darts, and snacks / beverages available for purchase on site. 

*Pro Gamers / VIPs will be in attendance. *

Pre-Register via meetup. 150 Person Capacity.

---

Leadership Opportunities:

We need someone that is passionate about Hearthstone and is willing to help spearhead this weekly Fireside as a Community Leader. If you are interested in helping us run events in NYC, please reach out. Forward your resume to [masked]

---

For More information about our partners check out the following links:

Nebulous Gaming NYC: https://www.facebook.com/NebulousGaming

Hearthlytics: 

http://hearthlytics.com

Blizzard FSG: 

http://us.battle.net/hearthstone/en/fireside-gatherings 

2ARC Gaming:

http://2arcgaming.com/

http://www.vicioushs.cards/

results.description:
People Who Get Ahead In Life

Are Those Who Can Communicate Effectively.

Wouldn't You Like To Develop This Priceless Skill?

Now You Can!”

Come to  West Side Talkers  and Get on The Road to Becoming The Best Speaker in Your Neck of the Woods!

Develop your public speaking skills in a Fun, Warm, Friendly and Enthusiastic environment. 

Ralph Waldo Emerson once said, “All great speakers were bad speakers at first”. Emerson was right because great speakers are not born; they are made!

But in order to transform yourself into a great speaker you have to show up! Woody Allen said it best.  "80 percent of success is  just by showing up. " 

West Side Talkers is vibrant toastmasters club that's creative and thinks out-of-the-box. Over the years we have incorporated additional valuable segments that we offer at our club which have been added on top of the already great Toastmasters model. At our club, our members do speeches and we provide constructive evaluations, and we host table topics, thought of the day, word of the day, etc. (These are all part of the Toastmasters model)

At West Side Talkers you will experience everything that a toastmasters club can offer and more. We take all the great things that are in the Toastmasters program and we take it up a few notches (well maybe more than a few!) so that we can bring more value to our members and guests.

Below are the ADDITIONAL ITEMS that we have incorporated into our meeting agenda which add more value to our members speaking development. (not part of the Toastmasters model)

SPEAKING TIP

Where you will pick up a valuable Speaking Tip by a Certified World Class Speaking coach which you can immediately use in your very next speech.

IMPROV COMEDY

As a member of West Side Talkers we take you through "actual" improv exercises to help you develop your emotional expressiveness, characterizations, and your spontaneity in your speaking more quickly and efficiently. Improv can help you FAST TRACK your speaking development and do it WHILE HAVING FUN!

COMMERCIAL MINUTE

IF you were asked at a networking luncheon to get up and talk for 60 seconds about your business and what you do, would you be able to do it effectively? As a member of West Side Talkers we can help you learn how to deliver effective 60 second commercials.

Please contact us via email if you have any questions about our exciting program.

At our “West Side Talkers” Toastmasters public speaking meetings we encourage people to challenge themselves and get up and speak. However, we do not force anyone to do so. You can learn a lot by just attending our meetings. By just coming to our meeting you have made an initial step towards challenging your fears...!!!

So whether you just want to conquer your fear of public speaking or you want to become a Champion Speaker – “West Side Talkers” will help you get there!

If you have ever been to other Toastmasters public speaking clubs, at West Side Talkers, you will experience a Toastmasters club like no other. Come To Our Next West Side Talkers Meeting and Experience it For Yourself!

When:

Thursday October 8th,  2015  7:00pm - 9:00pm

Where:

The Jewish Center 131 West 86th Street, 10th floor (between Columbus and Amsterdam)  New York, NY 10024

Cost:

$6  (this helps cover our overhead)  Pay at Door or Pay online By CLICKING HERE 

Reservation is Required!

How to RSVP for the next Tennis Lesson:

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 class = $35 Promo code = T15GR1

3 classes = $99 Promo code = T15GR3

6 classes = $179 Promo code = T15GR6

10 classes  = $269 Promo code = T15GR10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance


What's included? 
- Tennis Pro
- Learn something new 
- Meet fun people 
- Get some exercise 
- 1 hour lesson from a Tennis Pro and 1 hour of social hitting
- Racquet available if necessary


Attendance

Unable to attend or need to change the day?  If you change your RSVP on the the MindBodyOnline account with more than 48 hours of notice, you will have that class credited to use in the future with with no problem.  If you try to cancel within 48 hours on your MindBodyOnline account, you will be charged for the class as a late cancellation or No-Show. I understand things can come up, just be respectful to the class and other students to change your RSVP on the MindBodyOnline account to allow others to join in on that time slot.

WATCH THE VIDEO BELOW AND SEE THE F-U-N !!!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m86vJgPvsxo

ARE YOU READY FOR SOME TENNIS?!?!?


The main reason people don't play tennis in NYC is because: 

It is Too Costly (lessons and permit)

It is Difficult to obtain court space

It is too Hard to find someone to play with

People don't have a Racquet to play with

The good news is you found this site and the #1 resource for anyone interested in tennis in NYC.  At Tennis World, You will be able to:

Find Affordable Lessons

Have an available court

Plenty of People to Meet & Play With (Very Social Fun Group)

There is always extra racquets on hand to use at no cost

It doesn't matter if you have never played or a little rusty, this class is for you because everyone is a little rusty :-)

You'll learn the basics to stop hitting that tennis ball over the fence or chasing it on the other courts. You will learn great tips to start enjoying the game immediately.

Throughout these sessions, you will learn/practice: Ground strokes, serving, volleys, overheads, lobs, footwork and strategies. Each session will focus on different aspects and will provide ample time to practice too! 

In addition to improving your game, you will also get to MEET LOTS OF NEW PEOPLE and have an AWESOME TIME MAKING NEW TENNIS FRIENDS AND HITTING THE BALL. The sessions are both very social and technique oriented.

This event has sold out quickly in the past, so please make sure you RSVP quickly.

What to wear: You'll be running, jumping and moving around.  Make sure to wear sneakers & an outfit that will be appropriate for the weather and exercise. 

What to bring: We recommend water, towel and possibly a snack bar.  If you have a racquet, bring it down, otherwise one can be provided for you at no cost.

Want a Private or Semi-Private Lesson?

A package of Private lessons cost between $55-$65 and Semi-Private lessons (2 people in a class) cost $86.  Create an account at:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

Book your appointment online and Call or Text <a>[masked]</a> to confirm.

Weather and Refunds (Rain out?) 

In the event of the class being cancelled due to rain, you will not receive a refund, rather a credit that you will be able to apply for any future class during the week or weekend.  You can also contact: <a>[masked]</a>, to confirm before leaving your apartment to be on the safe side regarding weather and cancellations. 

Remember just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers, that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area but not where the courts are.  Lastly, if it does rain, how much rain is estimated, mostly it is passing showers and tennis can resume soon thereafter.

Check out the weather report on the link below:

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

Questions? 
- Please refrain from using the comment/conversation fields below. 

TEXT: <a>[masked]</a> for a quicker response. 

- Your instructor can be reached at <a>[masked]</a>, if you're running late/lost 
- Yes, bathrooms and fountains are close by the courts

DIRECTIONS:

These beautiful tennis courts are conveniently located at the end of the 3 train in Manhattan, which means they are just one block north. The surface is softer than most, well maintained, and has LIGHTS.


https://www.google.com/maps/place/2601+Adam+Clayton+Powell+Jr+Blvd,+New+York,+NY+10039/@40.8258611,-73.936799,17z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x89c2f67f79c87e27:0xba25e4f78a0fd23a

To see all possible directions of the various locations on how to arrive, visit the link below:

http://www.tennisworldnyc.com/where-to-play/

results.description:
GOD HELP THE CHILD by Toni Morrison
Spare and unsparing, God Help the Child—the first novel by Toni Morrison to be set in our current moment—weaves a tale about the way the sufferings of childhood can shape, and misshape, the life of the adult. At the center: a young woman who calls herself Bride, whose stunning blue-black skin is only one element of her beauty, her boldness and confidence, her success in life, but which caused her light-skinned mother to deny her even the simplest forms of love. There is Booker, the man Bride loves, and loses to anger. Rain, the mysterious white child with whom she crosses paths. And finally, Bride’s mother herself, Sweetness, who takes a lifetime to come to understand that “what you do to children matters. And they might never forget.”

A fierce and provocative novel that adds a new dimension to the matchless oeuvre of Toni Morrison.
results.name: October 2015 - GOD HELP THE CHILD

results.description:
Real Self Defense is Offensive in nature. 

KravMaguy offers a true, authentic Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) training experience emphasizing hand-to-hand combat, tactical and warrior training for both men and women. The Head instructor was featured in the History Channel – The Human Weapon- a documentary about Krav Maga in Israel. His last assignment was as Tactical Security Team Leader working off the coast of East Africa. 

In this basics class you will learn to defend yourself and survive knife wielding assassins, sexual assaults or any would be attacker looking to take your life using the basic principles of kravmaguy level one system. In the end only your are responsible for your own protection. You cannot rely on others when split seconds count.

Topics covered in Level One 8 week course:
Jab cross 
Fighting Stance
Weak body spots
Hook uppercut
Basic footwork
Punching jab cross
Elbows regular
Knees
Groin strikes- knees, shin to groin, groin jab (lead leg)
Knife hands
Escape- RNC
Escape guillotine
Escape schoolyard headlock (requires matted area)
Physical requirements to pass level one:
20 pushups
35 sit ups
30 squats
Level 2 training prep


check out this youtube video to see kravmaguy knife defense in action, these techniques are used by murderers and terrorists to kill countless innocents and knowing these basic defenses can save your life and the ones you love

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BbzLjAUlyzU

the eye rake to elbow to the spine: a kravmaguy classic:

results.description:
We will begin our evening with a few ritual demonstrations for creating sacred space, cleansing, clearing and healing. 

We will use minerals, crystals, elixirs, sound and angel cards to cleanse, align and bring in the highest healing vibrations into our scared space.

A ritual returns you to what matters. The very act of beginning a ritual puts us in a state of mind where we can break with the routine patterns of the mundane and remember the sacred.

What makes a ritual sacred?

A ritual is any action we take that has meaning beyond its appearance. What makes a ritual sacred, however, is the intention behind it. The word “sacred” comes from the Latin word sacrum, which relates to power or strength. So, a sacred ritual is an exchange or action that you imbue with meaning, thus giving it power. Rituals can have a impact on people’s thoughts, feelings, and behaviors.

All are welcome and will have an opportunity to receive Reiki healing.
results.name: Rituals and Reiki

results.description:
Join us as we discuss the novel The Circle by Dave Eggers .

Mae Holland is 24 when she starts working at The Circle, a ubiquitous Internet company (think Google merged with Facebook , Twitter, and Amazon), where over 10,000 employees work at its sprawling Silicon Valley campus. As Mae discovers, The Circle provides a lot-every workplace perk you can imagine-but it also requires total buy-in, which causes Mae to stumble at first, but she soon learns to embrace it. The Circle, meanwhile, is making the world safe and connected by putting tiny cameras everywhere and computer chips in children's bodies, hatching ever bigger plans while its detractors fall by the wayside. As Mae tries to keep up with The Circle's increasingly demanding requirements for participation and sharing, she falls under its spell, believing she is loved by her millions of followers while distancing herself-and worse-from her parents and oldest friends.


Novels at Night is  a book club for adults 21 years and older who enjoy reading and sharing their opinions about books. Join us monthly at the 9 Iron Grille (314 Paramus Road) to meet new people, sample great food** and drinks, and discuss books in a relaxed atmosphere.  Copies of this novel can be picked up at the Paramus Public Library (116 East Century Road). Please feel free to call the library with any questions about this program, (201) 599-1305.

We will be reading from Ascended Master written material for five Minutes or so and then practicing some simple Meditation Techniques of the Ascended Masters such as the I AM Decrees, Visualizations of the Golden Heart flame and the Violet Consuming flame of forgiveness and more... There will also be Plenty of time for discussion and Questions and Answers. This Meditation Practice will be Guided with also some time for Silence practice. It will be for about 15-20 minutes. We will be having this Group every month. Practicing in a group is know to greatly enhance our Spiritual experience so please join us and see. We ask that everyone practice silence about their personal spiritual experiences at the meetup group and only speak in a very general and light way, like this worked for me or I felt Joy or love etc. without going into details. This will make for a more equality consciousness in the group with out people standing out as being more spiritually Conscious then others.. it is not the purpose of this group to talk about our personal Spiritual experiences but to learn the teachings and techniques to have our own Spiritual experiences and awakening, that is our focus.

Mindy & Anthony

results.description:
Dr. Gregory A. Wilson will be the guest speaker at Dr. Kevin Pinkham’s Science Fiction class. The event with Dr. Wilson will begin at roughly 7:45 p.m. in HTS 5.

Dr. Wilson, Professor of English and Speech at St. John’s University, has published a number of academic works on texts ranging from the plays of Jonson and Marlowe to Ulysses and Mrs. Dalloway. His third book, Icarus, will be published as a graphic novel by Silence in the Library Publishing in 2015, and he has just signed a three book deal with The Ed Greenwood Group, which will be publishing his Gray Assassin Trilogy. In addition to his extensive academic work, he has published short stories and novels in the Fantastic Literature vein. Dr. Wilson will be joining Dr. Pinkham’s class to discuss the topic of writing Literature of the Fantastic, publishing, Science Fiction, Fantasy, and whatever other topics happen to come up during the conversation. Dr. Wilson received his Ph.D. in English from Brandeis University. For more information on Dr. Wilson: http://www.stjohns.edu/academics/bio/gregory-wilson

Thanks to member Fred Arzola for the heads-up!
results.name: Greg Wilson, Guest Speaker at Nyack College

Speak and Lead is one of three Toastmasters clubs in the Rutherford area. We cater to the after-work and evening crowd. Our goal is to help You obtain success! People join Toastmasters for an array of reasons, and therefore have different goals - but the common goal is self-improvement.

Whether you're joining so as to improve your communication/ presentation skills; or to become a better leader, Speak and Lead Toastmasters is here to help! Even if you simply are looking for an activity to engage in and just want to network, you can't go wrong here.

We're a friendly, supportive group that enjoys laughing and having a good time. We do things by the book and encourage all of our members to do their best. No matter what happens, we don't give up.

Won't you join us on your journey to success? The door is open - and we'll be talking.

results.description:
Thursday nights are now a potluck dinner night for the Orgasmic Meditation community here in NYC! And anyone over 18 who wants to check it out too!

If you are someone who already OMs or if you are curious and want to meet the OM community and check it out, or just meet some awesome people and enjoy a warm and electric evening of connection, come join us!!

Bring an item of food if you desire, and we will provide some extra food too so don't worry about it if you can't or don't have time. 

It's a casual atmosphere that might include some connection games. It's a great way to introduce friends to the concept of OM and the community itself since there will be lots of people there with years of experience in the practice. 

OMing will not take place AT the event but for those trained in the art there will be a circle beforehand at the usual time. 

The event is free! The door will open at 7:45 sharp and we will go until about 9:15. You're welcome to come anytime in between, unlike our other events which have tighter time tables. BUT we can't guarantee there will be any food left and you might miss some fun so try to come on time!

results.description:
Are you planning to go hiking this fall?  The bears will be out there too!  Are you safe?Come to the RMSC meeting on Thursday October 8 for a presentation on Bear Safety.  (Safety for YOU, not the bears)See you there.

Want to: Meet your new ski/boarding buddy?  Learn about trips, lift ticket discounts, instruction, racing, hiking, and the amazing lodge in central Vermont?  Play free foosball, pool, shuffle board or darts?  Come to a meeting (maybe buy a drink at the bar at a good price) and introduce yourself to the person* closest to you and next thing you know you will be in the middle of 6 degrees of snow-mazing separation.  Thursdays from September to April, the snow networking location is at the Knights of Columbus (KofC) in Ramsey, 8 PM.

Park across the street in the train station parking lot. Many meetings have special speakers or activities, so keep an eye out for costume parties, equipment lectures, and amazing stuff.

FYI: Attendance varies (20-50 people usually) and represents only a small fraction of our 300+ membership base.  There will always be lots of dedicated skiers and boarders who are not on meetup.com who are in the official Ramapo Mountain Ski Club. Members vary in age (8-80 year olds come to meetings), ability, availability (schedule wise), and martial status (aka dating wise) - but everyone is looking for the perfect snow partner ;0)

Ramapo Mountain Ski Club Web Site

*For first timers: ask for Elyse, Ken of Hospitality, or Maggie, our President, to sign-in, help answer questions and connect you to others in the club with shared interests.

Ski yah Soon!
results.name: Weekly Meeting - BEAR SAFETY PRESENTATION

• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (Your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests.)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Pablo G.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8:00PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Code of Conduct:

Positivity - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Safety - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

2 = Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Generosity!!!! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Pablo G.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

results.description:
“3 And I set my face unto the Lord God, to seek by prayer and supplications, with fasting, and sackcloth, and ashes: 4 And I prayed unto the LORD my God, and made my confession , and said , O Lord, the great and dreadful God, keeping the covenant and mercy to them that love him, and to them that keep his commandment; “ (Daniel 9:3-4; KJV)

Please join us for “Prayer for our Nation,” hosted monthly by The Daniel Team, the Prayer Ministry of the Christian Party of America. The “Prayer for our Nation” conference call is the second Thursday of every month at 8:30 PM eastern (7:30 central).  The Daniel Team is led by Luis Chiang.   You do not need to be a member of the Christian Party to participate in the prayer conference calls or the other monthly conference calls for the Christian Party.   If you would like to become a member of the Daniel Team, please send an email to [masked] requesting to join the prayer ministry.  Thank you.

For more information about the Christian Party of America, go to www.ChristianPartyonline.com.  And Please like us on Facebook at: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Christian-Party-of-America/198905400159491

Prayer Objectives:

1.  True repentance, in the hearts of our citizens, which manifests itself in our daily lives.

2.  The healing and restoration of families in America.

3.  The restoration of Biblical principles employed in the ruling of our nation from the local to the national level.

4.  To teach the Church to maintain this righteous life so that once America is restored we will continue to teach the Body (including our children) to maintain godliness in our personal and public lives.

Prayer Strategies:

1.  We need to search our hearts and ask the Lord to reveal to us any sins that may be preventing Him from fully answering our prayers. (Joshua 7:10)  Once revealed, we need to confess our sins to Him (and repent of them) and, if appropriate, to those whom we offended.

2.  We need to assume the sins of the nation on ourselves; just as Daniel did for the sins of the nation of Israel (Daniel 9).

3.  It is absolutely crucial that in all these endeavors that prayer be our primary focus.  We need to rely on prayer (Jesus) as the foundation for everything that we do.  In addition, prayer teams need to be set up that will pray before, during, and after all events, etc. in order to bath in prayer everything that we do.  These prayer teams will be the “heavy lifters” who will be moving heaven and earth for us as we fight to regain our nation.

4.  We should follow (among other prayers in the Word), the prayers of repentance and requests for restoration that we find in the Bible, as we pray for our nation.

Prayer Focus:

1.  Jesus is the only way and the only power that will enable our nation to turn around (2 Cor 7:14). We need to focus on Him and to trust in Him alone, as we confess and turn from our sins; that He will tear down the strongholds of the enemy in our nation and in our individual lives. “When the enemy comes in; like a flood the Spirit of the Lord will lift up a standard against him.” (Isa 59:19). We must not trust in any tactic, procedure, or whatever in order to overcome the devil (who is behind all of the evil that we see around us). “For our struggle is not against flesh and blood, but against the rulers, against the authorities, against the powers of this dark world and against the spiritual forces of evil in the heavenly realms.” Ephesians 6:11-13

2.  We need to ensure that we stay focused.  The enemy (Satan) will try different tactics against us, e.g., to get our focus off of that which is most important and to either divert our attention on that which is least important and/or try to get us to do too much.  He will probably try to bring division amongst us.  My guess is that it would be through misunderstandings, hurt feelings, etc.  We must be aware of this up-front, expecting the attacks and to realize that the attacks are coming from the enemy and not from what we can, e.g., see with our natural eyes.

Prayer Tactics:

1.  We need to find appropriate Scriptures to stand upon to bring before the Lord as we pray individually and corporately.  It is crucial that we not follow a hard fast cook book approach; even one that is based on the Bible.  We need to know what the Scriptures say and then to allow the Holy Spirit to use what He’s taught us to do or to pray those things that He brings to mind or puts into our hearts to do.  For example, don’t have the “Hail Mary” prayer approach, e.g., I always have to pray this way or to pray these prayers in this exact order.

2.  The Church needs to be actively involved in politics and other social endeavors such as education, health care, the legal system, etc. (if even just knowing what is going on). In politics, the Body should then intelligently and with Christ-like love contact their representatives making their viewpoints known.  These godly leaders need to then rally the Body perhaps at local auditoriums, stadiums, etc. in order show the Church the truth about how our nation began and how the Church was actively involved in all facets of social life for the first few hundred years of our pre- and post-national existence.  The Body needs to learn that we must stand on what God’s Word says and to fight for what’s ours (just as the Israelites entered the Promised Land, fought huge giants, and won). 

Finally, remember:

2 Chron 16:9 “For the eyes of the Lord range throughout the earth to strengthen those whose hearts are fully committed to him…”

PREPARATION FOR PRAYER-STUDY MATERIALS

Repentance from Idolatry

All the sins described below are the symptoms of a bigger sickness, which is denying God as our creator and not glorifying him and acknowledging him as the supreme ruler of the universe. Rom 1:29 states “All Unrighteousness” stems out from the root of idolatry (Rom1:23). So, fornication is not a sickness, it is one of the symptoms of idolatry, covetousness is not a sickness, it is another symptom of idolatry, etc.

It is very important to focus our prayer efforts on this first cause of sin, which is ignoring God, suppressing the truth, and replacing the Creator by the created. God and truth are self-evident, but we choose to rebel against it. What we need is to repent from that.

Studying the nature of repentance would help tremendously in our efforts to pray and intercede for people because repentance is the key to come back to God and be healed.

Rom 1:18  For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men, who hold the truth in unrighteousness;

Rom 1:19  Because that which may be known of God is manifest in them; for God hath shewed it unto them.

Rom 1:20  For the invisible things of him from the creation of the world are clearly seen, being understood by the things that are made, even his eternal power and Godhead; so that they are without excuse:

Rom 1:21  Because that, when they knew God, they glorified him not as God, neither were thankful; but became vain in their imaginations, and their foolish heart was darkened.

Rom 1:22  Professing themselves to be wise, they became fools,

Rom 1:23  And changed the glory of the incorruptible God into an image made like to corruptible man, and to birds, and four-footed beasts, and creeping things.

Rom 1:24  Wherefore God also gave them up to uncleanness through the lusts of their own hearts, to dishonour their own bodies between themselves:

Rom 1:25  Who changed the truth of God into a lie, and worshipped and served the creature more than the Creator, who is blessed forever. Amen.

Rom 1:26  For this cause God gave them up unto vile affections: for even their women did change the natural use into that which is against nature:

Rom 1:27  And likewise also the men, leaving the natural use of the woman, burned in their lust one toward another; men with men working that which is unseemly, and receiving in themselves that recompence of their error which was meet.

Rom 1:28  And even as they did not like to retain God in their knowledge, God gave them over to a reprobate mind, to do those things which are not convenient;

Rom 1:29  Being filled with all unrighteousness, fornication, wickedness, covetousness, maliciousness; full of envy, murder, debate, deceit, malignity; whisperers,

Rom 1:30  Backbiters, haters of God, despiteful, proud, boasters, inventors of evil things, disobedient to parents,

Rom 1:31  Without understanding, covenant breakers, without natural affection, implacable, unmerciful:

Rom 1:32  Who knowing the judgment of God, that they which commit such things are worthy of death, not only do the same, but have pleasure in them that do them.

Here’s an example of what causes repentance:

Let’s pray that America focus on the much that we have, so our hearts is filled with thanksgiving for his goodness towards us, and our hearts lead us to repentance.

Rom_2:4  Or despisest thou the riches of his goodness and forbearance and longsuffering; not knowing that the goodness of God leadeth thee to repentance?

Let’s pray that the end result of America’s tribulations, the recession, the aging and health deterioration of Americans, the financial distress, etc. work for our good, changing our hearts and drawing closer to God.

2Co_7:10  For godly sorrow worketh repentance to salvation not to be repented of: but the sorrow of the world worketh death.

Let’s pray that America realize that God wants every American to be saved and not face judgment. Let’s pray that our pastors emphasize the human responsibility in determining our final destiny

2Pe_3:9  The Lord is not slack concerning his promise, as some men count slackness; but is longsuffering to us-ward, not willing that any should perish, but that all should come to repentance.

Other observations on the word Repentance

The word repentance is used in connection with God, as well as with man. When it is used in connection with God, it is usually positive. God never repents to do good for his people. God repents himself from exercising judgment and punishment on his people.

Let’s pray that God will change his mind executing the punishment that we deserve.

Num_23:19  God is not a man, that he should lie; neither the son of man, that he should repent: hath he said, and shall he not do it? or hath he spoken, and shall he not make it good?

1Sa_15:29  And also the Strength of Israel will not lie nor repent: for he is not a man, that he should repent.

Psa_110:4  The LORD hath sworn, and will not repent, Thou art a priest for ever after the order of Melchizedek.

Psa_135:14  For the LORD will judge his people, and he will repent himself concerning his servants.

Jer_18:8  If that nation, against whom I have pronounced, turn from their evil, I will repent of the evil that I thought to do unto them.

Satan is the God of this world. He endows his faithful servants with power to promote sin from the top down. In that sense, it is very important to know that sin is not based on grass root strategies; it is a highly organized well-funded push strategy.

Blindness comes from Satan.

Let’s pray in the Name of Jesus and bind Satan’s power, rebuke his authority, and order him to take away his hands off America. Let’s pray that the spiritual veil be torn and people be able to see what’s evident.

2Co_4:4  In whom the god of this world hath blinded the minds of them which believe not, lest the light of the glorious gospel of Christ, who is the image of God, should shine unto them.

Joh 12:40  He hath blinded their eyes, and hardened their heart; that they should not see with their eyes, nor understand with their heart, and be converted, and I should heal them.

The realization of our sinful nature comes when we get in contact with God the Holy Spirit, and his different manifestations. In that sense, we are also empowered to expose sin because the Holy Spirit dwells in us and we can testify of him through our actions.

Let’s pray that God produces growth in us, and the works of faith that glorify Him “in us” serve as testimony that he lives. Let’s pray that the Holy Spirit be poured over America, so people be able to experience his conviction and turn away from idolatry.

Joh 16:8  And when he is come, he will reprove the world of sin, and of righteousness, and of judgment:

Isa 6:5  Then said I, Woe is me! for I am undone; because I am a man of unclean lips, and I dwell in the midst of a people of unclean lips: for mine eyes have seen the King, the LORD of hosts.

Luk 5:8  When Simon Peter saw it, he fell down at Jesus' knees, saying, Depart from me; for I am a sinful man, O Lord.

Let’s pray that we Christians devote our time reading the Word of God, so he continues the process of sanctification and purification. Let’s pray for zeal for his word, and that God appoints servants with the task of preserving the word of truth so the undiluted message is extended to the next generation.

Joh 17:17  Sanctify them through thy truth: thy word is truth.

The realization of our sinful nature comes when we get in contact with God the Holy Spirit, and his different manifestations. In that sense, we are also empowered to expose sin because the Holy Spirit dwells in us and we can testify of him through our actions.

Let’s pray that God produces growth in us, and the works of faith that glorify Him “in us” serve as testimony that he lives. Let’s pray that the Holy Spirit be poured over America, so people be able to experience his conviction and turn away from idolatry.

Joh 16:8  And when he is come, he will reprove the world of sin, and of righteousness, and of judgment:

Isa 6:5  Then said I, Woe is me! for I am undone; because I am a man of unclean lips, and I dwell in the midst of a people of unclean lips: for mine eyes have seen the King, the LORD of hosts.

Luk 5:8  When Simon Peter saw it, he fell down at Jesus' knees, saying, Depart from me; for I am a sinful man, O Lord.

Let’s pray that we Christians devote our time reading the Word of God, so he continues the process of sanctification and purification. Let’s pray for zeal for his word, and that God appoints servants with the task of preserving the word of truth so the undiluted message is extended to the next generation.

Joh 17:17  Sanctify them through thy truth: thy word is truth.

Excerpts from the Book of Daniel (Chapter 9):

 “…3 So I turned to the Lord God and pleaded with him in prayer and petition, in fasting, and in sackcloth and ashes.

4 I prayed to the LORD my God and confessed:

“Lord, the great and awesome God, who keeps his covenant of love with those who love him and keep his commandments, 5 we have sinned and done wrong. We have been wicked and have rebelled; we have turned away from your commands and laws. 6 We have not listened to your servants the prophets, who spoke in your name to our kings, our princes and our ancestors, and to all the people of the land.

7 “Lord, you are righteous, but this day we are covered with shame—the people of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem and all Israel, both near and far, in all the countries where you have scattered us because of our unfaithfulness to you. 8 We and our kings, our princes and our ancestors are covered with shame, LORD, because we have sinned against you. 9 The Lord our God is merciful and forgiving, even though we have rebelled against him; 10 we have not obeyed the LORD our God or kept the laws he gave us through his servants the prophets. 11 All Israel has transgressed your law and turned away, refusing to obey you.

“Therefore the curses and sworn judgments written in the Law of Moses, the servant of God, have been poured out on us, because we have sinned against you. 12 You have fulfilled the words spoken against us and against our rulers by bringing on us great disaster. Under the whole heaven nothing has ever been done like what has been done to Jerusalem. 13 Just as it is written in the Law of Moses, all this disaster has come on us, yet we have not sought the favor of the LORD our God by turning from our sins and giving attention to your truth. 14 The LORD did not hesitate to bring the disaster on us, for the LORD our God is righteous in everything he does; yet we have not obeyed him.

15 “Now, Lord our God, who brought your people out of Egypt with a mighty hand and who made for yourself a name that endures to this day, we have sinned, we have done wrong. 16 Lord, in keeping with all your righteous acts, turn away your anger and your wrath from Jerusalem, your city, your holy hill. Our sins and the iniquities of our ancestors have made Jerusalem (America) and your people an object of scorn to all those around us.

17 “Now, our God, hear the prayers and petitions of your servant. For your sake, Lord, look with favor on your desolate sanctuary. 18 Give ear, our God, and hear; open your eyes and see the desolation of the city that bears your Name. We do not make requests of you because we are righteous, but because of your great mercy. 19 Lord, listen! Lord, forgive! Lord, hear and act! For your sake, my God, do not delay, because your city and your people bear your Name. ”

Excerpts from the Book of Ezra (Chapter 9):

After these things had been done, the leaders came to me and said, “The people of Israel, including the priests and the Levites, have not kept themselves separate from the neighboring peoples with their detestable practices, like those of the Canaanites, Hittites, Perizzites, Jebusites, Ammonites, Moabites, Egyptians and Amorites. 2 They have taken some of their daughters as wives for themselves and their sons, and have mingled the holy race with the peoples around them. And the leaders and officials have led the way in this unfaithfulness.”

3 When I heard this, I tore my tunic and cloak, pulled hair from my head and beard and sat down appalled. 4 Then everyone who trembled at the words of the God of Israel gathered around me because of this unfaithfulness of the exiles. And I sat there appalled until the evening sacrifice.

5 Then, at the evening sacrifice, I rose from my self-abasement, with my tunic and cloak torn, and fell on my knees with my hands spread out to the LORD my God 6 and prayed:

“I am too ashamed and disgraced, my God, to lift up my face to you, because our sins are higher than our heads and our guilt has reached to the heavens. 7 From the days of our ancestors until now, our guilt has been great. Because of our sins, we and our kings and our priests have been subjected to the sword and captivity, to pillage and humiliation at the hand of foreign kings, as it is today…

10 “But now, our God, what can we say after this? For we have forsaken the commands 11 you gave through your servants the prophets when you said: ‘The land you are entering to possess is a land polluted by the corruption of its peoples. By their detestable practices they have filled it with their impurity from one end to the other. 12 Therefore, do not give your daughters in marriage to their sons or take their daughters for your sons. Do not seek a treaty of friendship with them at any time, that you may be strong and eat the good things of the land and leave it to your children as an everlasting inheritance.’

13 “What has happened to us is a result of our evil deeds and our great guilt, and yet, our God, you have punished us less than our sins deserved and have given us a remnant like this. 14 Shall we then break your commands again and intermarry with the peoples who commit such detestable practices? Would you not be angry enough with us to destroy us, leaving us no remnant or survivor? 15 LORD, the God of Israel, you are righteous! We are left this day as a remnant. Here we are before you in our guilt, though because of it not one of us can stand in your presence.”

5.  Pray that the Lord will rise up godly pastors (or Church leaders) who will agree to work together to preach and teach on preparing the Church, e.g., to first of all pray and fast for our nation in small and large gatherings (at work during lunch hour, at home, in parks, at church, at social gatherings, etc.) around our nation; asking the Lord to have mercy on America (as we, as Christians confess our sins of idolatry, ambivalence, etc. to Him.  Also, these leaders should teach of the need for the Church to be actively involved in the world (to be the salt and the light of the world).  But, everything - absolutely everything should be focused on love; the Father’s agape love being shown to the world.  “A new command I give you: Love one another. As I have loved you, so you must love one another.  By this everyone will know that you are my disciples, if you love one another.” (John 13:[masked])

As an example of a godly leader raising the awareness of God’s people to gather together in repentance, is Ezra:

Excerpts from the Book of Ezra (Chapter 10):

“While Ezra was praying and confessing, weeping and throwing himself down before the house of God, a large crowd of Israelites—men, women and children—gathered around him. They too wept bitterly. 2 Then Shekaniah son of Jehiel, one of the descendants of Elam, said to Ezra, “We have been unfaithful to our God by marrying foreign women from the peoples around us. But in spite of this, there is still hope for Israel. 3 Now let us make a covenant before our God to send away all these women and their children, in accordance with the counsel of my lord and of those who fear the commands of our God. Let it be done according to the Law. 4 Rise up; this matter is in your hands. We will support you, so take courage and do it.”

5 So Ezra rose up and put the leading priests and Levites and all Israel under oath to do what had been suggested. And they took the oath. 6 Then Ezra withdrew from before the house of God and went to the room of Jehohanan son of Eliashib. While he was there, he ate no food and drank no water, because he continued to mourn over the unfaithfulness of the exiles.

7 A proclamation was then issued throughout Judah and Jerusalem for all the exiles to assemble in Jerusalem. 8 Anyone who failed to appear within three days would forfeit all his property, in accordance with the decision of the officials and elders, and would himself be expelled from the assembly of the exiles.

9 Within the three days, all the men of Judah and Benjamin had gathered in Jerusalem. And on the twentieth day of the ninth month, all the people were sitting in the square before the house of God, greatly distressed by the occasion and because of the rain. 10 Then Ezra the priest stood up and said to them, “You have been unfaithful; you have married foreign women, adding to Israel’s guilt. 11 Now honor[a] the LORD, the God of your ancestors, and do his will. Separate yourselves from the peoples around you and from your foreign wives.”

12 The whole assembly responded with a loud voice: “You are right! We must do as you say. 13 But there are many people here and it is the rainy season; so we cannot stand outside. Besides, this matter cannot be taken care of in a day or two, because we have sinned greatly in this thing. 14 Let our officials act for the whole assembly. Then let everyone in our towns who has married a foreign woman come at a set time, along with the elders and judges of each town, until the fierce anger of our God in this matter is turned away from us.” 15 Only Jonathan son of Asahel and Jahzeiah son of Tikvah, supported by Meshullam and Shabbethai the Levite, opposed this.

16 So the exiles did as was proposed. Ezra the priest selected men who were family heads, one from each family division, and all of them designated by name. On the first day of the tenth month they sat down to investigate the cases, 17 and by the first day of the first month they finished dealing with all the men who had married foreign women.”

(Technical Support: <a>[masked]</a>)


The Inner Engineering online program includes guided meditations, powerful breathing techniques, and deeply engaging discourses about the nature of the mind and practical wisdom to manage life’s situations.

Inner Engineering is a combination of methods derived from the ancient science of yoga that addresses every aspect of human well-being — from your body, mind and emotions to the fundamental of life energy within. 

This 1 hour introduction to Inner Engineering explains the fundamental approach of the program in a live setting that offers you the opportunity to ask a trained Isha teacher questions about the program and practices available.

“Inner Engineering is neither a religion, nor a philosophy or dogma; It is a technology for wellbeing. One does not have to believe or disbelieve, you just have to learn to use it. Technology will produce results irrespective of who you are.” – Sadhguru
