results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include... 

30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bottom of the Manhattan side of the Williamsburg Bridge.
results.name: Hill Running Workout

Looking to spend Columbus Day weekend in the Adirondacks Lake Placid area.

Drive up early Friday and do a short hike in the Lake Placid area. Afterwards stop in town for dinner and supplies then head to house. Saturday plan a full day hike for either Mt Marcy or Whiteface. There are many short to long hikes in the area so feel free pick a hike you would want to do. This site list many of the hikes in the area: http://www.lakeplacid.com/do/outdoors/summerfall/hiking

Sunday we can pick an easy hike and check out the town. There is also kayaking and biking available.

We can do some sightseeing Monday as we head back home.

Rental for house is $120. House sleeps 12.

PayPal $120 to [masked] and once I receive it I will add you to the Attending List.

You'll be on the waitlist until I receive payment.

Michael Shinn

CEO of Atomicorp

Michael has been a Computer Security and Forensics Analyst for the White House, and helped develop the first commercial intrusion detection device. He is also the Co-founder of Plesk, acquired by SW Soft (now Parallels).


Christina Morillo

Information Security at HedgeServ

An Information Security Architect with expertise in Identity Access Management, Christina is currently at HedgeServ. When she is not focusing on protecting the firm from both internal & external threats, she is very active in the NYC tech community.


Jonathan Corbett

Entrepreneur & Civil Rights Advocate

"Entrepreneur and civil rights advocate, Jon is a self-described Professional Troublemaker." The TSA certainly thinks so - his YouTube video demonstrating that you could get a gun through the TSA body scanners got millions of views, and was covered by hundreds of media outlets.


Brett Thomas

CTO of Vindicia

Brett Thomas is CTO of Vindicia, a solution for optimizing subscription revenue. Brett was an early engineer at PGP, and will discuss what it was like to be a "foot soldier' in the crypto wars. Brett has particular expertise in the design and implementation of high volume e-commerce systems, encryption, and security.


Riley Drake

2013 Thiel Fellow & Director at MIT

Riley is a Biohacker, a hacker/explorer of physical spaces, a Director at MIT and a 2013 Thiel Fellow.


Mikko Ohtamaa

CTO of Trees.delivery

CTO of Secure Medical Marijuana startup Trees.delivery. Expert on securing your bitcoin, and on using bitcoin to secure your startup. Twitter: @moo9000


Elissa Shevinsky

Co-Founder of Secret Conference

Elissa Shevinsky is CEO of Jekudo Privacy Company. Backed by Mach37, Jekudo is building security tools for the enterprise. Shevinsky is also a writer and speaker on issues security, privacy and innovation. She has most recently spoken at O'Reilly Solid, DefCon, Shmoocon, Computers Freedom and Privacy, and SXSW. Elissa also writes for publications like Business Insider and Christian Science Monitor. Elissa has been building successful startups since she joined Geekcorps as an R&D intern in 2000. She learned how to build software at Everyday Health (filed for IPO in 2010) in 2003.


Michael Latulippe

Co-Founder of Secret Conference

Michael Latulippe is Founder of the community organization Bay Area Software Engineers (BASE) with chapters in San Francisco, New York City, and Boston where he organizes events around emerging technologies and best practices. Classically trained on piano and a lover of the arts, sciences, and technology, Michael is an advocate for privacy concerns and understands the importance of personal privacy to a free society. Michael also advocates for digital currencies, computer driven vehicles, cannabis reform, Web security and for scientific research.

Disclaimer

Views or opinions expressed by speakers or sponsors at our local New York Software Engineers community events do not necessarily express the opinion or views of the Software BASE organization and we do not take responsibility for the views expressed or the actions of speakers or sponsors/employers at our local events. 

We Are Growing

Software BASE's New York City chapter has grown by leaps and bounds these past few years and we are proud to announce that New York Software Engineers is going to continue to grow and develop our ecosystem with job fairs, code labs, meetups, conferences, networking parties, and innovative events on emerging technologies.  We couldn't do it without our members and we want to thank you for being apart of this growing organization.

results.description:
First off, it was great to see everyone at our very first—and very successful—WEN Fall Expo. What an incredible group of women we have! We're keeping the buzz going with an enlightening upcoming talk from author and brand architect Jocelyn Greenky Herz.

Come hear her share the inside secrets on the do’s and don’ts in the workforce, handling office politics, tips, insights, and humorous stories that will shed light on upping your professional game.

Jocelyn’s book The Big Sister’s Guide to the World of Work:  The Inside Rules Every Working Girl Must Know received a Starred Review by Publisher’s Weekly and rave reviews from USA Today, ELLE, Washington Post, NY Post, Cosmopolitan, NY Times and many more.

The book is written to provide positive and inspirational sound advice, threaded with humor and real life stories to help women in the workplace.

We are thrilled to have Jocelyn as a guest speaker this month as she has held audiences at Fortune 500 companies, colleges, universities and women’s groups such as:  Viacom, Kraft General Foods, Syracuse University, Villanova University, NYU, St. Joseph’s Hospital, Women in Business and more  In addition, she’s also written for The Huffington Post, and has inked advice columns for Gotham and Hampton’s Magazine, Boca Raton Observer and others.  

This is a good one, folks! Be sure to mark you calendars—and bring a pen to take notes.
results.name: Shhh! The Inside Rules Every Working Girl Must Know

results.description:
Lets make Friday Mornings the time to expand our stitch knowledge. Each class is $8 and includes yarn. Bring either an H crochet Hook or a size 7 knitting needle depending on the class you are taking. Needles and Hooks are available at an additional charge if needed.

When you sign up for the class you need to let me know which time slot you want. There is a limit to 2 people per time slot and both of you must take the same stitch. Samples are available when you come in. 

If you take the Crochet class you must understand how to at least chain and sc easily.

If you take the Knit class you must understand Cast on, K, P & Cast off.

9:00 - 9:30am - Crochet Stich

9:30 - 10:00am - Knit Stitch

10:00 - 10:30am - Crochet Stitch

10:30 - 11:00am - Knit Stitch

Additional days and hours can be accommodated by request. Beginner classes are available if you need them, just give the shop a call.

results.description:
Other than strict RSVP rules (if you say you're coming and you don't show, you're out of the group), this is a chill game, open to anyone who <a>signs up</a>.

Here's what separates this group from many others:

• Chill, positive attitudes. (People without forgiving personalities don't last long in this group, let alone in a given game.)

• Good quality equipment: $145 match balls; solid small goals - not pop-ups!

• Freshly laundered, adult-size, pillowy soft pinnies.

• We won't ever over-crowd a game. The size of pitch we use is best suited for 7v7. We're happy to make the pitch smaller if numbers are low. But we won't make it bigger or allow more than 7 players per team. 


• The small fee we ask of each player (at least $3 per session) supports a non-profit that we created and run: a high school soccer league for under-funded schools that don't have sufficient resources for after-school programming. 

See nyisl.com or the below video for more info. about our <a>program</a> for under-served public school students.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WzbNWu-N-ig

We use your game-fee to help pay for our high school players' new soccer boots, socks, shin guards and much more (e.g., the league website, goals, and other equipment). 

We're particularly fond of in-kind donations: soccer boots, socks, shins, shorts, etc. 

If you have any of these, please bring them to your game and we'll be more than happy to waive your game fee!
results.name: Sign-Up Soccer for Social Change

results.description:
Hello Friends!

This week we are excited to have Dana Spiegel of FounderTherapy come by and share.

As a Founder and Chief Code Therapist at FounderTherapy, Dana helps early stage startups bring their software products to market, implementing best practice software development processes, building agile software teams, and architecting scalable systems and infrastructures. He also helps founders and company leadership understand the necessary ingredients to create highly performant, resilient teams.

Dana is an advisor to a number of startups, including Work Market, ORGANIZE, VOIQ, Subblime, Librify, InterviewJet, and ClearServe. He's also a mentor for startups at Startupbootcamp SF.

Previously, Dana was the VP of Product and Engineering at Axial, which operates a membership-only network for qualified buyers and sellers of privately held businesses. Prior to Axial, he was Head of Product Development at OnForce (acquired by Adecco), where he created a number of patented technologies.

He's consulted for and worked at a number of early stage Internet startups, including FareChase (acquired by Yahoo!), OrderGroove, and Transparensee Systems. Also IBM and Scholastic.

Dana has BS in Brain and Cognitive Sciences/AI from MIT and an MS in Media Arts & Sciences from the MIT Media Lab.

In his spare time he is the Executive Director of NYCwireless, a non-profit that creates free, public Wi-Fi hotspots.

We'll get a chance to hear about all his journey, with Q&A and community shout outs afterwards! Also join us for good coffee, good bagels, and excellent conversation.

Until then, stay cool and classy... See you this Friday!
results.name: Founder's Friday with Dana Spiegel (FounderTherapy)

results.description:
We have had a few cancellations ... If you were hoping to join us ... Now is your chance! REGISTER TODAY!!!

Join the Team at Scrap-a-Doodle-Doo for our upcoming Fall Crafting Weekend Get-Away Event 


Date: Friday, October 9th starting at 10:00 AM through Sunday, October 11th until 5:00 PM. 
Place: Homewood Suites a Hilton hotel located at 375 Corporate Drive in Mahwah, NJ 

The events that we host at the Homewood Suites are a little smaller and cozier than our larger events. We will have prizes; a handful of vendors; electric at every table; a tool station with a Cricut Expression and over 70 cartridges in our Lending Library; the Big Shot Embossing machine with several dies and embossing folders; access to the hotel's Business Center and gym; give-aways; FREE Wi-fi; and some fun surprises!

Scrap-a-Doodle-Doo will have a booth set up featuring some of your must-have supplies for purchase (i.e. cardstock; adhesive; flowers; a sampling of the new arrivals, as well as custom kits and oodles of brand new titles). In addition, we will arrange for a private shopping trip for all attendees who wish to go visit the Scrap-a-Doodle-Doo store (which is just 1.4 miles away from the hotel) where we will have a full array of products.

WEEKEND PACKAGE PRICE IS: $259.00 


(Extra cropping space available for an additional cost) 

The price includes: Your cropping space (3 feet); dinner on Friday; a light breakfast; lunch; dinner and late night themed dessert on Saturday and a light breakfast and lunch on Sunday, as well as snacks and beverages all through-out the weekend.  

We have selected the theme Tiffany's for the weekend just to make it fun and interactive! Think diamonds, pearls and a little blue box! 

*** If you decide to stay over at the hotel, please make reservations on your own. *** Scrap-a-Doodle-Doo has group rate of $109.00  

A nonrefundable deposit of $100 is required at the time of registration. You may register in person, call us at[masked] or register online at: www.shoptheDOO.com


If paying online, please select store pick up as your delivery method to avoid shipping and handling charges. If the balance is not paid 30 days prior to an event, an additional $25 late charge fee will be applied. There are no refunds for cancellations made within 14 days of the start of an event nor any transfers to a future event.

More details to follow for those attending.
results.name: Fall Crafting Weekend Get-Away at the Homewood Suites

arrive early for seating and registration

results.description:
Hey peeps we need help setting up for the rummage sale at Saint Marks! Who can spare a bit of time for a good cause? They are collecting and pricing items from now until this date and then from 2pm until 6pm the day before the sale we will be setting the items out on the tables, making sure things all have prices, sorting according to type, etc. We need helping hands all during this time so come when it fits your schedule, stay an hour or as long as you can. ANY and all help is appreciated!  I will arrive by 2pm and stay as long as I can, hopefully the whole time for set up.

Here is the link to the church, we will be in the community center right next door:  https://www.facebook.SaintMarksKeansburg com/

Also we are taking donations of baked goods to sell the next day so if you can bake anything for us we would be so grateful! The holidays are coming and we have a lot of families to help out so any money we can earn now we need!

Oh and another perk to helping set up is we can shop in advance so if you want to buy anything from the sale you can set it aside and pay before you go home. I don't know about you but I can always find one or two good things at a rummage sale!

So I hope to see YOU there!  With Love and in the Light, Cassie

Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 4:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
The Profiteer cohort, Victor Menezes and Kaisa Filppula, present their final project - Gear Circles, an AirBnB for the sports gear marketplace. 

Both Kaisa (by way of Finland) and Victor (by way of Brazil) fuse their love of extreme sports with the latest FinTech technology in order to develop their product.  Kaisa is an extreme back-country skier and rock climber; while Victor rollerblades, snowboards and skydives, when he is not a Hackathon champion, in his spare time.  Gear Circles is built on top of GeoDjango, DRF, Google Identity Toolkit/Maps APIs, PayPal API and more.

A graduation celebration and networking will occur after their presentation.  Light refreshments will be served.
results.name: FinTech & Extreme Sports: Gear Circles Student Final Project

results.description:
This is the club's official meetup night. Currently, we are engaged in an epic campaign spanning across uncharted territories, on the fringe of the known Universe. "Cryptic and sinister ambitions sought by clandestine players behind the scenes, clash in a race for power and forbidden knowledge, drawing in a gossamer cast of characters, who aim to win at all costs, no matter the stakes! Who will unravel this allegoric enigma, and lay claim to its rapturous glory? And what unknown perils may this seductive wanderlust unleash!?" Heralds of Ruin is a 40k variation of the Kill Team rules. Armies begin at 200 points, and include every faction in the game, plus a few old chestnuts, long forgotten. Players build up and improve their forces weekly, in typical campaign setting fashion. You can find the "Heralds of Ruin" Kill Team rules here:Heralds of Ruin Kill Team Rules

,
results.how_to_find_us: Send us a message, we'll give you all of our contact info and DaBunka's address

results.description:
Host:  TEDxNewYorkSalon.   Must register with TEDxNewYorkSalon first.  

To RSVP, click here. 

"Join us this Friday at The Olivia (315 West 33rd Street), for a TEDxNewYorkSalon guest facilitated by Ron Gross. Doors open at 5:00 pm, the screening begins at 5:30 pm. Tickets are available free of charge, on a first-come, first-served basis. 

For nearly six years, our unique salon has gathered thinkers, doers and change-agen

ts in the spirit of sharing ideas worth spreading. Each event is personally designed by our organizing team, using TED content to spark meaningful conversation. 

To RSVP, click here. 

About the Facilitator  

Ron Gross 
Ron co-chairs the University Seminar on Innovation at Columbia University, and is the founder-director of Conversations New York. His books include Peak Learning, Socrates’ Way, The New Professionals, Individualism, and Independent Scholarship. In 2013 Ron was inducted into the Hall of Fame for Lifelong Learning of the International Adult and Continuing Education Association. Formerly with the Ford Foundation, he has led lifelong learning initiatives in Europe, the Far East, Israel, and Mexico." 

*************************

Welcome to TEDxNewYorkSalon!

Unlike most TEDx events which focus on a presentation format, TEDxNewYorkSalon is designed by our team of curators to spark conversation and dialogue, throughout the event. Rather than spotlighting individual speakers or facilitators, we create the soft space for hard conversation. During these gatherings, we screen one evocative TED Talk (via projector) and follow-up with a lively conversation afterward. The featured TED talk is a surprise, but we promise it will be something that will ignite deep thinking and connection. We look forward to seeing you there! 

To receive our weekly invitation via email, click here.

Many thanks to our venue sponsor:

The Olivia, A Stonehenge Property, 315 W. 33rd Street.

Contact TEDxNewYorkSalon

results.description:
Our first ever "Evening of Readings"

Each session will be 30 minutes 

J.D. Will be available for Intuitive and Card readings. J.D. is a natural intuitive who has been doing readings for over 15 years. She will hep you to navigate your path and works from the philosophy that all sessions, should help, heal and empower you!

She has been on several radio shows, been a guest speaker at FDU for 4 years in a row, presented and read all over the north east and is a Reiki and energy healer. 

Kenneth Dawe will be available for Dream Interpretations. Kenneth has been a guest presenter and reader all over New Jersey. He is a master at his craft and will help you to find your personal meaning for your dreams. He does not use prescribed generic meanings to make something fit, rather he helps you to unlock the dream symbols as they pertain specifically to you

Eileen Sweeney will be available for Intuitive and Angel Readings. Eileen Sweeney is an artist, writer and empathic channeler. After experiencing a great awakening in 2012, Eileen underwent a massive transition and began walking her authentic spiritual path. Along the way, she rediscovered her creativity and passion for inspiring others. Eileen has always believed that angels are eagerly awaiting an invitation to help guide each of us everyday. Through her intuitive readings, Eileen will bring you uplifting and positive messages from the angels. She will also empower you to ‘tune in’ to connect and communicate with the angels around you. You will feel encouraged and inspired to express your own true unique self and to continue your life’s journey according to your higher purpose.

Pick your reader and pick your time slot!

• 6:00-6:30

• 6:30-7:00

• 7:00-7:30

• 7:30-8:00

• 8:00-8:30

• 8:30-9:00

• 9:00-9:30

• 9:30-10:00

results.description:
*Kindly RSVP when you know you can definitely make it, either for all or part of the evening in Park Slope (my apartment from 6-8:30pm; V-Spot restaurant/bar after 8:30pm).  Thanks!


Hey everyone!

I thought a casual, chill vegan potluck at my place would be a fun way to get to know everyone better and enjoy some awesome vegan food, personalized!

I will be serving my V3 favorites (fast, easy vegan dishes with 3 ingredients that take 3 minutes to prepare):

- Kale salad with tahini sauce and soy chorizo

- Lentils with cubed tempeh and broccoli


- bread "toastettes" with avocado and tomato

**And a surprise cocktail!  :)

Each attendee brings their favorite vegan dish, dessert or appetizer.  Can be whatever you love and would love to share!

I can accommodate approximately 20 people (at least 10 seats including couch, chairs and floor cushions) in my apartment, and if you'd like to bring a  pillow or cushion or something, I have lots of floor space in the living room for both sitting and standing/mingling!


We can eat, drink, socialize at my place from 6-8:30ish, then we can head to V-Spot down the street for dessert/more drinks!  So if anyone can't come to the apartment potluck, feel free to show up at 8:30pm at the apartment and head with us to V-Spot, or just meet at V Spot after 8:30pm

My cell is[masked] to text  or call and I can let you know timing when we may head to V Spot
results.name: Vegan Potluck in Park Slope!

results.description:
PLEASE RSVP ON DHARMA DRINK MEETUP PAGE (www.dharmadrink.com - thank you!)

 

A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

Meeting monthly at the Rubin during the summer - but special events will be announced like "Dharma Drink at the Beach or the Park" plus special group visits to see amazing teachers as the come to NYC over the summer!  Should be awesome!!!

 

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelug - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other. We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist  hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more, the merrier.

Time:  6-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

 

www.dharmadrink.com
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink opposite the Ganesh statue - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hangout for Buddhists and like minded people

results.description:

Making ideas happen - building code, or learn how to code. If you have projects on the way and would like to share them with the community, we are all ears. Need some assistance? We are all here to work with you!


Great Co-Working nights to come!

INTERESTED IN A SOTECHIE COWORKING MEMBERSHIP?  

Go to SoTechie NYC CoWorking Space to learn more

If you would like to present a project you are working on or just want to announce something to the group... Let me know!!!

results.description:
For beginners and experienced meditators.

Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Based on traditional Buddhist teachings, it has become an increasingly popular practice, as it generates both concentration and a deep understanding of the nature of our connection to ourselves and others.

This is a drop-in event, and pre-registration is not necessary. We're offering it on a donation basis, and request each participant to contribute between $10 - $20 to support this and other initiatives led by The Interdependence Project. 

Please visit http://theidproject.org/events/2015/06/05/metta-meditation-group for details. 

Please note that our space is not wheelchair accessible and can only be reached by climbing two steep flights of stairs!
results.name: Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM) Group - Every Friday!

results.description:
Hey Flyy Girl how have you been? We haven't seen you in while. Or maybe you haven't made it to your first meetup yet. Or maybe I just saw you last week. Either way this meet up is for you! It's our Flyy Girl Fall Mixer!

Join us in the atrium of Brookfield Place for Friday night bites, meeting each other and just hanging out and being chill with your fellow Flyy Girls.

Plenty of eating options Food Directory

Even though it's our Fall Mixer we'll be grabbing some seats or sitting on the steps in the beautiful Winter Garden area of Brookfield Place or if it's nice maybe outside.

It's a little tricky to navigate your way in the financial district but plenty of trains stop there and helpful directions will be sent closer to the day. 

Come and go when you feel like. But do come on by!
results.name: Flyy Girl Fall Mixer

results.description:
Hyatt Place is a new hotel in downtown Flushing, located just a block away from the Main St. stop of the 7 train.  It is also accessible via every bus line that goes though Flushing (Q20, Q44, Q25, Q34, Q27, Q17, Q65, Q48, Q13, Q28, Q16, Q58, Q12, Q66, Q19, Q50, Q15, Q26).

We mostly play newer "euro" style board games (Ticket to Ride and Settlers of Catan are among the oldest) that often run 1.5 to 3.0 hours. If you arrive while games are going on, prepare to hang out and chat while they finish up then organize for a new game.

We are permitted to bring food into the lobby, but EVERYONE MUST BUY AT LEAST 1 THING FROM THE BAR, AND TIP THE BARTENDER VERY WELL. The venue we are using is a business and we want them to be glad to have us there.


Please keep noise level down to a minimum to avoid distracting the hotel guests and clean up after yourselves (the trash area is just a few feet away).

Note, we will be sharing a hotel bathroom key, so please do not return it to the bar until the evening is over.
results.how_to_find_us: Walk toward the back of the lobby, we'll be on the raised section on the left.
results.name: Friday evening gaming at Flushing

results.description: Whether you have just finished your first term of German language classes at the Goethe-Institut and would like to keep your hand in, or you consider getting started learning German and want to get a first impression of the language - just join us at our monthly get-together and practice your German in a fun and relaxing atmosphere! Everyone is welcome!

Please signup ASAP and may the force be with you :)

In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

This is a New York Black Entrepreneurs Network exclusive networking and business card exchange event @ G Bar located at 578 Grand Concourse corner of 150th Street.  This mixer is for founders, entrepreneurs, small business owners, investors, dreamers, doers, business professionals and startup professionals. Bring plenty of business cards. There is a one drink or appetizer minimum to support the establishment and to join our mixer.   

 Happy Hour Drink Specials · $7.00 Drinks · $5.00 Beers. Dress code is business casual. RSVPs required.  

G Bar Lounge: 

http://www.gbarnyc.com/ 

http://www.yelp.com/biz/g-bar-bronx

Required: 

A business card or an index card on an idea or problem you are having currently in your business. Please write your email address on the index card. I will be sending a scanned list of all business cards and index cards by the end of the week.

We encourage everyone to patronize this establishment by purchasing at least one drink or make reservations for dinner. 

Directions:

2, 4, 5 Train to 149th Street Grand Concourse

venue.name: New York New York Historical Society,

results.description:
Featured Exhibits:

Al Hirschfeld Join us to view the work of this quintessential NYC artist who defined NYC popular culture as a contributor for The New York Times for seven decades. His celebrity portraits had a distinct and well loved style - to be "Hirschfelded" was a sign a performer had made it.

Superheroes in Gotham chronicles the history of superheroes in NYC and the ways in which the early comics influenced contemporary comics, cartoonists and painters.

Please meet us again between 8-815 at the front door and we will go somewhere nearby for drinks and food.

See you there!
results.how_to_find_us: Meet us in front of the museum between 545 and 6:15. Our photos are to the left under Organizers.
results.name: NEW YORK HISTORICAL SOCIETY PAY WHAT YOU WISH AL HIRSCHFELD

results.description:
I received the following letter from Dr. Cipolla of Arba Sicula.
NOTE: please RSVP to me and not to Dr. Cipolla by Oct. 7th so I may let him know!

+++++++++++++++++++++++++++

Dear Members of Arba Sicula,

This is a reminder that on October 9, at 6:00 PM, we will be hosting Viginti Millys, a great folk group coming to us directly from Sicily. As I am not sending invitation by mail, I urge you to notify your friends who are members of Arba Sicula and don’t have access to the internet. It’s going to be a beautiful evening of song and dance by a talented group of performers whose photo I am attaching.

As usual there will be refreshments after the performance and it’s free for AS members and their guests.

Please RSVP so I know how much food to order.

I hope to see you there.

Regards

Gaetano Cipolla
results.name: Arba Sicula presents Viginti Milyss Folk Group

results.description:
30 & Over Fall Singles Mixer (Light Appetizers, Prizes, Ice Breakers)!
Get your tickets at:  http://www.clickmixers.com/over30.html

Autumn is here and it's a great time to get out there and make new friends and find that special someone. We realize that online dating can be tedious and all the bars in NYC are packed with 20 somethings. That's why we've created this great event filled with more mature singles.

So what's a Click event? Ever find yourself looking across the bar and saying, “He’s cute, I wonder if he’s single” or “She seems nice, but maybe she has a boyfriend". Well, wonder no more! Everyone at a Click event is single and looking to meet someone. At every Click event we set up fun ice breakers to get the party going (during which you can win prizes!) You can participate or just relax and mingle at your own pace.


THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. OVER 150 SINGLES WILL BE ATTENDING. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.

TICKET PRICE: $20
Ticket price will be going up to $30 at the door so we recommend getting them ahead of time to save money and guarantee your spot.
GET YOUR TICKETS AT: http://www.clickmixers.com/over30.html

WHEN: FRIDAY OCTOBER 9TH, 6:30 PM - 10:30 PM
(If coming in from a distance, it's okay if you arrive at 7:00 or after)
WHERE: PRANNA LOUNGE (79 MADISON AVE, NYC )

* Over 150 Single Professionals Attending!
* Suggested Age Range: 30s, 40s & 50s Welcome To Attend
* Drink Specials!
* Free Light Passed Appetizers From 7 to 8
* Icebreakers With Chances To Win Prizes!
* Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling
* Typically 70% of Attendees Come Alone (30% bring friends)
* Dress Code: Neat, Professional or Trendy (No sneakers, gym wear or t-shirts)

One of the great things about a Click event is that we do our best to gender balance our mixers.... Meaning that we keep the male/female ratio close and never let our parties have either WAY too many men or WAY too many women. As we get closer to the event date, we may shut down ticket sales for one gender to help keep the ratios balanced. Therefore we highly recommend getting your ticket/s as soon as possible to secure your spot.

TICKET PRICE: $20
Ticket price will be going up to $30 at the door so we recommend getting them ahead of time to save money and guarantee your spot.
GET YOUR TICKETS AT: http://www.clickmixers.com/over30.html

results.description:
Folks
Lets meetup to watch Grand Illusions-
Staged Photography from the Met Collection.

Photographers, like ventriloquists, can cast "voices" in a seemingly infinite number of genres and period styles. This does not negate the camera's direct relationship to the world—tying image to subject as naturally as a footprint—but instead reveals that photographs are always admixtures of fiction and reality tilted toward one end of the scale or the other.


The selection also points toward photography's inherently promiscuous relationship with other mediums such as literature and film, not to mention its persuasive powers when used in advertising.



Admission Fees: 


Pay as you wish always.

Getting there: 
BY SUBWAY

To reach the museum by subway, take the 4, 5, or 6 train to 86th Street. 

BY BUS

To reach the museum by bus, take the M1, M2, M3, or M4 bus on Madison or Fifth Avenue.

Looking forward to seeing you there.

Cheers!
results.name: Exhibition- Grand Illusions- Staged Photography from the Met Collection

results.description:
And the winner by a healthy margin is The Martian. The breakdown of votes is as follows:

The Martian- 8

Sicario- 4

The Intern- 4

Hotel Transylvania 2- 3

We'll be catching the 7:05pm showing of the Martian at the AMC Loews 34th Street 14 theater. We'll be meeting in the lobby of the theater at 6:30pm to give everyone time to meet and get decent seats. 

We'll be eating after the movie at the Skylight Diner, about a block away from the theater. Normally, getting seats here isn't a problem, but it may be a little more difficult than usual, since this weekend is Comic Con. We should all still be able to get seats, but may be split into smaller groups in the diner- just a heads up.

After the dinner, for those who simply don't wish the evening to end, we'll head to a nearby bar to continue with our stimulating and intellectual discourse- or just keep talking and stuff.

*I still have discounted ticket vouchers available. The normal ticket price is $14.79. The cost of the voucher is $11. Not a huge discount, but every little bit counts, right? If you're interested in reserving a voucher before the event, let me know and I'll send you the info you need. Any vouchers that haven't been reserved before the event will be available for cash purchase when we meet.
results.name: Dinner and a Movie: The Martian

group.name: ...And That's Why You're Single Speed Dating Parties

results.description:
A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  7-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

Please see the following Meetups too!

Buddhist Events New York     and

Zen / Chan Buddhist Activities

www.dharmadrink.com
results.why: Because Buddhists and like minded people are great to hang-out with.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink, the high table overlooking the lower level and closest to the elevators - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hang-out for Buddhists (& like minded)

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: María Angélica García

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
We'll have two groups running at the same time: Middle Beginners and Lower Intermediates.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and María Angélica García from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over fourteen years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. María Angélica is a dynamic instructor from Venzuela with a good sense of humor, very patient and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues from the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

ABOUT RSVP: Keep in mind that for all our paid events, RSVP does not guarantee a spot, only advance payment does

WHERE TO FIND US

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

See where we are in a map---> HERE

CANCELLATIONS: You can cancel and get a full refund anytime up to 48 hours before your workshop start time. Read more HERE

¡Nos vemos!

Jorge

results.description:
30 & Over Fall Singles Mixer (Light Appetizers, Prizes, Ice Breakers)!
* This is not a BBW specific event. All are welcome to attend.
Get your tickets at: http://www.clickmixers.com/over30.html

Autumn is here and it's a great time to get out there and make new friends and find that special someone. We realize that online dating can be tedious and all the bars in NYC are packed with 20 somethings. That's why we've created this great event filled with more mature singles.

So what's a Click event? Ever find yourself looking across the bar and saying, “He’s cute, I wonder if he’s single” or “She seems nice, but maybe she has a boyfriend". Well, wonder no more! Everyone at a Click event is single and looking to meet someone. At every Click event we set up fun ice breakers to get the party going (during which you can win prizes!) You can participate or just relax and mingle at your own pace.


THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. OVER 150 SINGLES WILL BE ATTENDING. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.

TICKET PRICE: $20
Ticket price will be going up to $30 at the door so we recommend getting them ahead of time to save money and guarantee your spot.
GET YOUR TICKETS AT: http://www.clickmixers.com/over30.html

WHEN: FRIDAY OCTOBER 9TH, 6:30 PM - 10:30 PM
(If coming in from a distance, it's okay if you arrive at 7:00 or after)
WHERE: PRANNA LOUNGE (79 MADISON AVE, NYC )

* Over 150 Single Professionals Attending!
* Suggested Age Range: 30s, 40s & 50s Welcome To Attend
* Drink Specials!
* Free Light Passed Appetizers From 7 to 8
* Icebreakers With Chances To Win Prizes!
* Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling
* Typically 70% of Attendees Come Alone (30% bring friends)
* Dress Code: Neat, Professional or Trendy (No sneakers, gym wear or t-shirts)

One of the great things about a Click event is that we do our best to gender balance our mixers.... Meaning that we keep the male/female ratio close and never let our parties have either WAY too many men or WAY too many women. As we get closer to the event date, we may shut down ticket sales for one gender to help keep the ratios balanced. Therefore we highly recommend getting your ticket/s as soon as possible to secure your spot.

TICKET PRICE: $20
Ticket price will be going up to $30 at the door so we recommend getting them ahead of time to save money and guarantee your spot.
GET YOUR TICKETS AT: http://www.clickmixers.com/over30.html

venue.name: New York Society for Ethical Culture

results.description:
Marty and Mary Murphy have moved back into their beachside Staten Island house, intending to repair the damage done by Hurricane Sandy and resume the life they lived there for decades. They soon find that fixing blasted walls and removing toxic mold is the easy part, accomplished with mere hard work and humor. Reviving the close-knit community they helped build, on the other hand, opens old wounds, pitting neighbor against neighbor and laying bare the fault lines in their own family.


Come at 6:30 for a reception and after the reading participate in a discussion of the ethical issues of the play led by Betsy Ungar. Playreading starts at 7 pm..

These tend to be excellent with an interesting discussion of the ethical issues afterward. Please note: there is a requested donation of $10 (which I think from past experience is more than just optional, so I would plan on paying $10 if you attend) and the reception is normally not a meal....so I highly recommend eating supper before attending.
results.how_to_find_us: I will be greeting folks by the food reception table, I look a lot like my photo! :-)
results.name: Playreading and Ethical Discussion: "By The Water," by Sharyn Rothstein

Get your tickets at: http://www.clickmixers.com/over30.html

Autumn is here and it's a great time to get out there and make new friends and find that special someone. We realize that online dating can be tedious and all the bars in NYC are packed with 20 somethings. That's why we've created this great event filled with more mature singles.

So what's a Click event? Ever find yourself looking across the bar and saying, “He’s cute, I wonder if he’s single” or “She seems nice, but maybe she has a boyfriend". Well, wonder no more! Everyone at a Click event is single and looking to meet someone. At every Click event we set up fun ice breakers to get the party going (during which you can win prizes!) You can participate or just relax and mingle at your own pace.


THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. OVER 150 SINGLES WILL BE ATTENDING. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.

TICKET PRICE: $20
Ticket price will be going up to $30 at the door so we recommend getting them ahead of time to save money and guarantee your spot.
GET YOUR TICKETS AT: http://www.clickmixers.com/over30.html

WHEN: FRIDAY OCTOBER 9TH, 6:30 PM - 10:30 PM
(If coming in from a distance, it's okay if you arrive at 7:00 or after)
WHERE: PRANNA LOUNGE (79 MADISON AVE, NYC )

* Over 150 Single Professionals Attending!
* Suggested Age Range: 30s, 40s & 50s Welcome To Attend
* Drink Specials!
* Free Light Passed Appetizers From 7 to 8
* Icebreakers With Chances To Win Prizes!
* Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling
* Typically 70% of Attendees Come Alone (30% bring friends)
* Dress Code: Neat, Professional or Trendy (No sneakers, gym wear or t-shirts)

One of the great things about a Click event is that we do our best to gender balance our mixers.... Meaning that we keep the male/female ratio close and never let our parties have either WAY too many men or WAY too many women. As we get closer to the event date, we may shut down ticket sales for one gender to help keep the ratios balanced. Therefore we highly recommend getting your ticket/s as soon as possible to secure your spot.

TICKET PRICE: $20
Ticket price will be going up to $30 at the door so we recommend getting them ahead of time to save money and guarantee your spot.
GET YOUR TICKETS AT: http://www.clickmixers.com/over30.html

results.description:
Hey Brooklyn Swing Friends!

SWING DANCE with Dancewave this Friday at our East Coast Swing Class

6:30-7:30pm at 182 4th Avenue Brooklyn!

Want to learn to Swing Dance? Intimidated by the "Pros"? Here's your chance to learn the basics of swing that will get your feet hoppin! Build your swing dance vocabulary each week as we learn a new step every class! Suzie Q, Hammerlock, and Swivel your way to become a pro! East Coast Swing is a fun and easy-to-learn class is not only good exercise, but it's a great way to meet new people and make new friends! Classes are designed for both drop-in students and regular attendees, so even if you can't attend every class, you'll still be able to pick up the moves, have fun and make great progress in your swing technique. No dance partner is necessary, as we will rotate dance partners throughout class. Each month we'll learn a new dance routine so there will always be new material to learn! 

Join us every Friday from 6:30 – 7:30 pm at 182 4th Avenue Brooklyn

For more information about Dancewave’s Swing Class –  CLICK HERE!

Questions?  <a>[masked]</a>
results.name: Brooklyn Swing Dance Fall Meetup

results.description:
Startup Weekend Food Edition is returning this year!

The startup movement has accelerated growth in many New York industries, but events centering around food have been few and far between; those trying to bridge the industry problems and creative people to develop innovative solutions are even less frequent. Our goal for this event is to connect people who are passionate and tackle the tough challenges in the food industry, all while learning-by-doing, firsthand, what makes a business successful. We're all super excited to see what ideas people will come up with for this event, and we're planning some sweet surprises (pun intended) for everyone! Details: http://nyc.up.co/events/7363


Tickets (early bird tickets available until 9/27): http://nycswfood2015.eventbrite.com/?aff=meetup

First time to Startup Weekend? Read this: http://startupweekend.org/about/firsttimer/
results.name: Startup Weekend Food Edition ($80 early tickets via Eventbrite until 9/27)

You want a highly-academic, highbrow tour of the Metropolitan Museum of Art where we stand before the great masters, contemplating their skilled use of line and form, while simultaneously placing them in the pantheon of other art historical geniuses, right?

You picked the wrong tour.

Welcome to Museum Hack VIP, our premiere museum experience.

Perfect for a date night, an evening with friends or a capstone to a New York City visit, our famous VIP tour guides will show you the secrets, backstories and hidden nooks and crannies of the Greatest Fucking Museum on Earth.

This "by New York City residents, for New York City residents" tour will show you the Met like you have never seen it before. *Please remember that this Meetup listing may not have accurate information - the people who have RSVPed may not have PAID/SIGNED UP. Please check attached link for the most accurate details!
results.name: VIP Museum Tour

results.description:
Do you love that beautiful soft wash of color that you see on greeting cards? 

Do want to know how to do it but you aren't quite sure how to start? 

Do you want to learn new techniques to bring your greeting cards to the "next level"? 

This class is for you! Tonight, Heidi will be teaching watercoloring techniques that are easy to recreate on your own projects after you leave class. We will make FOUR cards that will be beautiful and packed with gorgeous details. 

                                       (Card Example-Splitcoast Stampers)

We will focus on the Remarkable You Stamp Set ($33 value) & the Aqua Painters  ($17 value) both from Stampin' Up!. This stamp set is so gorgeous! The flowers are really big and pack a lot of pizazz on a card. They would be breath taking on art journal pages, too.


There are two price options for this class: 

• $50-Class Instruction, FOUR Cards, Remarkable You Stamp Set in Photopolymer (The Wood Mount Stamp Set is also available for an additional $12), Aqua Painters (set of 2)--THE CLASS IS BASICALLY FREE!

• $20-Class Instruction & FOUR CARDS (no additional take home product)

***Please be sure to write in the correct payment amount upon your RSVP. 

***RSVP by September 21st to guarantee your products AT the event! RSVPs after 9/21/15, may not get your products at the event but will receive them at the next event that you attend. This is due to ordering/shipping time from Stampin' Up!
results.name: Watercolor Cards Class-TWO PRICE OPTIONS (Read Class Details Carefully & RSVP)

venue.address_1: Tito Puente Education Complex 240 East 109th Street. Entrance right off 2nd Ave
venue.name: Tito Puente Education Complex

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!
results.how_to_find_us: soccer, indoor soccer, futsal, new york futsal, futsal across america, futbol, futbolito, fifa

Fun for Families, Kids & Teens!

refreshments, glow sticks, face painting, photo booth photos, crafts, Wii / Xbox dance and Minecraft gaming, Lego construction game, other games and more!
Or spin the wheel to win a prize or turn!

Friday Japanese/English Language Exchange

Join us for 2 hours every “Friday Japanese / English Language Exchange!" In this event, you will get to learn about English and Japanese as well as socialize with other members! If you would like to practice and learn more English and Japanese, then this is your event!

毎週金曜日２時間実施される金曜日、英語日本語語学交流会にぜひお越し下さい！イベントでは日本語と英語を学ぶことはもちろんのこと、他のメンバーさんとの交流も楽しんで頂けます。

Details:

Lessons: Varying levels of Japanese and English lessons are given at multiple stations, focusing on aspects such as grammar, listening, and conversation.

Language Exchange: After the lessons, we have a free exchange for people in both languages.

詳細:

レッスン：文法、リッスニング、会話などに焦点をおいた日本語、英語のそれぞれのレベルに合わせたレッスンが受講できます。

語学交流会： レッスン後、両語学による自由な交流会をになります。

Time:

Every Friday, from 6:45pm to 8:45pm

Entrance fee: $5.00

Location:

Pearl Studios

500 8th Avenue 4th Floor New York, NY 10018

Ask for Room 412!

If you arrive before 6:30pm, please wait downstairs. An organizer will be waiting with a sign and will bring you to the classroom when we are ready. If you arrive after 6:45pm, check in with the guard, and remember to bring a form of legal ID. Go to the 4th floor and look for us there!

Don't forget to bring a notebook!

Here are some pictures from our latest session!

Tantra - Beginner's Weekend - Oct 9th - 11th

Tantra: The Art of Conscious Loving seminars provide the education we never had and always needed in order to have wonderful, real and lasting love, and to rediscover the full potential of our sexual energy.

Have you ever felt there must be something more to sexual loving? In just a few days, you will discover the ancient secrets of female and male sexual ecstasy. You will learn to use sexual energy for increased intimacy, spiritual connection, healing, pleasure, harmony, and freedom. Turn sex into a relationship practice of healing energy, renewal, and transformation.

Learn a variety of Tantric techniques with Tantra Master Charles Muir, Leah Alchin,  and his Source School of Tantra Yoga instructors in our Beginners Weekend Seminar. No prior knowledge or experience is necessary. There is no nudity in the seminar. The at-home Saturday night practice is optional.

Tantra: The Art of Conscious Loving seminars provide the education we never had and always needed in order to have wonderful, real and lasting love, and to rediscover the full potential of our sexual energy. "Rather than a "touchy-feely" course about sex, Tantra: The Art of Conscious Loving is a spiritual yet practical guide to being present and intimate with the most important person in your life. Sure there was a lot of discussion of sex, but only in the context of celebrating yourself, your partner, your love and of life itself...this should be required learning for all people."

Have you ever felt there must be something more to sexual loving? In just a few days, you will discover the ancient secrets of female and male sexual ecstasy.You will learn to use sexual energy for increased intimacy, spiritual connection, pleasure, harmony and freedom. Turn sex into a relationship practice of healing energy, renewal and transformation.

Are you tired of chasing weak orgasms? Women can experience longer, deeper, faster and more powerful orgasms. Men can orgasm without tiring ejaculations. You can tap into an endless, spontaneous flow of creative, love energy.

In Ancient India, Tantric sex was taught as an art form that every conscious person must master. Now you can learn these ancient and proven skills translated as a 21st century art form and experience harmonious, joyful union.

MUST REGISTER IN ADVANCE - $495 (see payment options)

click here - Tantra Beginner's Weekend - Oct 9-11

Class Schedule:

FRIDAY, OCT 9TH ~ Please arrive at the seminar location by 6:45 pm on Friday night. Class will end at about 10 pm. We will keep the singles after class for a half hour for orientation.

SATURDAY, OCT 10TH ~ Class will start promptly at 10 am. There will be a two hour lunch break roughly between 1:30 - 3:30 pm. Class will end at 7:30 pm so you have time for home-play. Choosing a partner for home-play is optional for singles. If you have young children at home we recommend organizing child care for the evening so you can have this special time for yourself.

SUNDAY, OCT 11TH ~ Class will start promptly at 10 am. There will be a two hour lunch break roughly between 1:30 - 3:30 pm. We will close the class with a special ritual by no later than 9 pm.

WHAT TO BRING ~ Bed pillow for comfort and to be used as props for some of the exercises. Your favorite personal refillable water bottle and/or insulated hot beverage mug, both with tight-fitting lids (if desired). This helps us tread more lightly on Mother Earth. However, we provide if needed. Dress for comfort. Yoga type clothes seem to be the best with layers for cool and warm weather. We encourage you to bring the following items to beautify your room: candles/matches, flowers, and personal sacred items. These items are also available in our "sacred shopping" Tantra store. Please refrain from smoking or wearing perfume during the seminar due to the prevalence of allergies/sensitivities.

Trainers - Charles Muir & Leah Alchin

See/Hear Charles & Leah

answer FAQs about Tantra - Source Tantra Videos

and watch Additional Videos on You Tube

Beginners' Workshop begins at 6:30 pm.  Contra Dance is a traditional American folk dance which requires no prior dance training or experience—if you can walk, you can Contra Dance.  Traditional Contra Dancing is done with "Ladies and Gents" but at Gender Role-Free Dances we dance whichever role we like and with whomever we like!  Our monthly dances are open to everyone, regardless of sexual orientation, gender expression, dance experience and number of left feet.

Our caller for Oct is Donna Hunt, renowned caller,  and the band is Street Cred, with Audrey Knuth on fiddle , Amy Engelsberg on keyboard, and Mike Sokolowsky on guitar. They are one of the new, young bands and they've got the beat! They will get your feet moving in no time.


Join us after the dance for socializing at the Village Den around the corner at 11th St. and Greenwich Ave.

For more information, check out our new website: www.villagecontra.org or our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/groups/villagecontra/

results.description:
Improvisation classes leading to a performance group.

SPOLIN-IST is seeking players who are willing to explore Viola Spolin's Theater Games through a series of classes. Players who pursue the training will have the chance to be a part of our shows at Caffe Vivaldi scheduled to start in early 2016. Classes are open to both actors and non-actors.

NOTE FOR MEETUP MEMBERS: There is a separate group of players following our classes, so please note that there will be more players in a class than the RSVPs in meetups.

Fee : 

Four classes : 

$120 ($30 per class)

Drop-in : $35 per class 

PayPal: [masked] / or CASH

Director/Sidecoach: Ege Maltepe ( www.egemaltepe.com )

Contact: [masked]

*********************************************************************

A letter from award winning actor/director/writer Alan Alda about his experience with Viola Spolin. Alda was among the young actors who worked with Spolin along with Alan Arkin in Young Actors Company.


Compass Thoughts My memory of Compass at Hyannisport is that we prepared during rehearsals by inventing characters and then improvising as those characters in a variety of situations. Having a character to fall back on gave us some sense of security later, when we faced audiences during spot improvisations. But I felt mostly that we were operating on pure guts. Guts improvising seemed less appealing a year or so later when I was introduced to Viola Spolin's improvising games. Here was a whole system that could be relied on. There was no joke making required, or even allowed, and yet the scenes that emerged were often hilarious. Rather than gags or conventional sketch comedy, what became funny was surprising human behavior. The main thing that emerges in Spolin's games is not the invention of funny stuff, but the discovery of things in you that you didn't know where there. It's true that a harder, laugh-oriented kind of performance is probably more appropriate for a cabaret show, but I think we might have benefitted from some training in Spolin's Theater Games before we set out to be consciously funny. The benefits of relating to the other player and the resulting spontaneity, I think, can be beneficial to any kind of playing. In fact, the games help in a surprising range of ways. I'm teaching Viola's games to scientists now and we're finding that after a short course in improv workshops, the scientist are able to speak about their work to audiences with far more clarity and vividness than they could before. Their increased willingness and ability to connect with the audience is remarkable. I've always been grateful for all my improvising experience — at Compass, in Spolin-style workshops, and in experimental workshops devised by people who have devoted themselves to exploring this special world of spontaneity. I hope these explorations grow as more people discover the pleasures of freely entering into the group experience. Paradoxically, one pleasure of the group experience is the emergence of one's own self. Alan Alda - December 26, 2011 https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alan_Alda
results.name: SPOLIN IMPROVISATION WORKSHOP

results.description:
Anna Bolena

Soprano Sondra Radvanovsky embarks on her quest to vocally conquer all three of Donizetti’s historic Tudor queen operas in the same season, here as a young royal grasping at power and paying a terrible price. Bass Ildar Abdrazakov is King Henry VIII, not one of history’s kindest husbands; mezzo-soprano Elina Garanca is Jane Seymour, the king’s consort and the reason the queen loses her head. Tenor Stephen Costello plays the queen’s love interest in Sir David McVicar’s gripping period production. Marco Armiliato conducts. 

Anna Bolena full 2011 Production:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uG5qf9czgRM

Act I 


England, 1536. At Richmond Castle, courtiers discuss the state of royal affairs: Queen Anne’s star is sinking since King Henry VIII has fallen in love with another woman. Jane Seymour, Anne’s confidante and lady-in-waiting, appears, followed by the queen, who admits to Jane that she is troubled. Anne asks her page Smeaton to sing a song to cheer everyone. His words remind her of the happiness of her first love, which she gave up to marry the king.

Alone in her bedchamber, Jane—who is in fact the king’s new lover—is conscience-stricken about her betrayal. Henry appears and passionately declares his love, promising Jane marriage and glory. She is disturbed by his threats about Anne’s future but realizes that it is too late for her to turn back.

Anne’s brother, Lord Rochefort, is surprised to meet Lord Richard Percy, the queen’s former lover, in Richmond Park. Percy, who has been called back from exile by the king, has heard of Anne’s distress and asks about her. Rochefort answers evasively. Percy admits that his own life has been miserable since he and Anne have been apart. The king arrives with a hunting party, followed by Anne and her ladies-in-waiting. He coolly greets his wife, then tells Percy that he has the queen to thank for his pardon. In fact, he has arranged Percy’s return as a trap for Anne and is grimly amused at their emotion and embarrassment as they greet each other. He orders one of his officers to spy on the couple.

Smeaton, who is in love with the queen, is on his way to her apartments to return a miniature portrait of her that he had stolen. He hides when Anne appears with Rochefort, who persuades his sister to admit Percy. Percy enters and declares his continuing love. Anne admits that the king hates her, but she remains firm and pleads with Percy to find another woman worthy of his affection. Just as he draws his sword and threatens to kill himself, Henry bursts in. Smeaton proclaims the queen’s innocence and in the process the furious king seizes the miniature, providing him with welcome proof of his wife’s seeming infidelity. Anne, Percy, and Smeaton are arrested.

Act II
Anne has been imprisoned in her London apartments. Jane arrives to tell her that she can avoid execution by pleading guilty and confessing her love for Percy, thereby allowing the king to remarry. Anne refuses, cursing the woman who will be her successor. Jane admits that she is that woman. Shocked, Anne dismisses her, but then gives in to Jane’s desperate pleading, insisting that it is the king, not her, who is to blame.

Smeaton has falsely testified to being the queen’s lover, believing that his confession would save Anne’s life, but in fact he has sealed her fate. Anne and Percy are brought before the council. Anne tells the king that she is ready to die but begs him to spare her the humiliation of a trial. In the following confrontation, Percy claims that he and Anne were married before she became the king’s wife. Even though he thinks this is a lie, Henry triumphantly replies that another, worthier woman will ascend the throne. Percy and Anne are led away. Jane pleads with Henry for Anne’s life, but he dismisses her. News arrives of the council’s verdict: The royal marriage is dissolved and Anne and her accomplices are to be executed.

Anne is in a state of delirium. She imagines herself on her wedding day, then recalls her girlhood love for Percy. Her fellow prisoners are brought in and Smeaton blames himself for having caused Anne’s impending death. When bells and cannon fire are heard, announcing the king’s new marriage, Anne suddenly comes to her senses. She furiously curses the royal couple and goes off to face her execution.

Tickets

Please visit www.metopera.org  Then, select your seat of choice. 


Meeting Details

We will meet halfway between the opera house and the fountain, where the grade changes from concrete to stone.  We will also meet at intermission on the lower level (below the orchestra) lounge for drinks or tea. There are high tops there and it is less frequented so it will be comfortable for making conversation between acts. 

See you soon!
results.name: Anna Bolena by Donizetti at the Metropolitan Opera House

results.description:
NYSC Open Circle

At:  208 W 29th St Rm 201, New York, NY
(between Seventh & Eighth Avenues)

Come and join our shamanic community in a sacred celebration of Spirit. Learn the basic techniques of core shamanism as you journey to meet your Spirit Guides and Power Animals. Deepen your shamanic practice through drumming, chanting, and movement at our monthly Shamanic Circle.

Please bring a drum or a rattle, a pen & notepad, and a bandanna. You may want to bring a pillow, blanket to use when we journey.

Suggested donation $20


By subway take: N, R, Q, to 34th Street station or #6, & #1 to 28th Street station.

*****************************************************************


The core NYSC group has been practicing healing and journeying work every week since 1997. We work and study with a wide range of powerful indigenous and Western shamans from around the world.

NYSC MISSION

NYSC promotes and supports a shamanic community in New York City. Through our regular gatherings and workshops with shamans from around the world, NYSC seeks to promote earth-honoring living in ways that foster environmental, social and spiritual balance.

Looking ahead, our vision is to establish the New York Shamanic Center, the home for all of NYSC's events, activities and gatherings, including an Annual New York Shamanic Film Festival.

Ethics and the Theater will present a play reading of By The Water, by Sharyn Rothstein

 Marty and Mary Murphy have moved back into their beachside Staten Island house, intending to repair the damage done by Hurricane Sandy and resume the life they lived there for decades. They soon find that fixing blasted walls and removing toxic mold is the easy part, accomplished with mere hard work and humor. Reviving the close-knit community they helped build, on the other hand, opens old wounds, pitting neighbor against neighbor and laying bare the fault lines in their own family. Come at 6:30 for a reception and after the reading participate in a discussion of the ethical issues of the play led by Betsy Ungar

Matt Antar  Matthew Benson  Amber Bogdewiecz  Carole Chamlin  Jerry Chamlin  Andra Miller  Shaun Roberts

results.description:
Learn to act while overcoming stage fright. Meet new people and increase your confidence and poise. 10-session program. Scene Work - Improvisation - Monologue Study - Showcase Performance opportunities.

The focus is on relaxation and natural performance based on sound fundamental acting technique. We also provide the unique opportunity to perform before live audiences in our own in-house showcase productions.

Acting programs are often very intimidating. The instructors are harsh and anxiety is not addressed. We offer a more humane and effective alternative. Our program is designed to empower as well as guide you through the acting experience.

Many people who attend our classes have never acted before and just need a supportive environment to try it out. We work in very manageable steps. You will not be asked to do anything you are not comfortable with.

Please do come in and see for yourself, if the program is right for you.

Initial session is free of charge. If you do decide to enroll at the
Free Trial, you will receive a $49.00 discount, and 2 bonus sessions.

Discounted rate:$250 for 12 sessions.

Regular rate: $299 for 10 sessions

results.description:
Thank you to everyone who came to our last Game Night!  It was heaps of fun and conquest!   :)

We hope you join us on our next Game Night for a chance to meet tons of new people, play some great games, and drink a few beers. And make sure to invite your friends! We'll have Jamaican/Caribbean dominoes as well. This is one of our favorite strategy games and we would love to share it with the experienced and inexperienced alike.

In addition to dominoes, we will have Settlers of Catan, King of Tokyo, BANG!, Cards Against Humanity, and others. If you'd like to bring your own games, there will be lots of people who like to learn new games.  And again, all are welcome!

Also make sure to bring some cash for a donation.  Though donations are not required, if you are able to donate we suggest $5 for gaming and $5-10 if you're drinking and gaming. Organizing this is 100% volunteer and all the money goes to this MU page, refreshments, and renting the space.

We do not provide food, but there are lots of take-out and delivery options nearby.

See you there!!

results.description:
IMPROV FOR ACTORS - Express Yourself

This Improv for Actors workshop will focus on expressing emotions. You will learn techniques that will help you work through emotional blocks and freely express emotions. 

Many actors are more comfortable expressing anger or apathy than they are expressing more vulnerable emotions such as sadness, fear or even love. Through exercises, theater games and scene work you will practice expressing a variety of emotions so you can expand your emotional range and have more choices as a performer.

A fun safe and non-competitive environment is created in which each participant will learn how to work through inhibitions and tap into their imaginations. 


THE BENEFITS OF IMPROV


Improv can help you reduce stage fright, perform with more ease, increase your emotional range, build rapport with your scene partners, and have more fun on stage.


Many actors get “stuck in their heads” and as a result feel paralyzed and/or disconnected when performing. Improv skills give the actor tools that will get them out of their heads and into the scene.


*Suggested Donation: $15 (most improv classes cost $35-$50 ea. in NYC.)


**Please note that there are no shoes allowed in the studio.**
results.name: Express Yourself

Lorelei Black x Brian Bruno

Draw from a nude model!

We focus on short, challenging poses (though we include a few 10- or 15-minute poses on request).
